text: I'm a Buffalo,NY transplant.  The pizza and wings are the best I have tasted anywhere.  , Friday, August 7th I ordered a pizza for takeout at 12:19pm.  I was told it would be ready in 30 minutes.  Got my pizza at 1:30pm!!!  I counted 40 patrons in the restaurant with one preparer and one server.  The server was waiting on tables, taking phone orders, cleaning tables, and handling the register.  The preparer was throwing pans and told the server to stop taking orders. Customers were walking out.  So sad to see such a great restaurant implode over lack of staff.

I used to love Naked City Pizza but the last 2 times here on Paradise it was very subpar. If Chris the owner is not there cooking don't eat here. The new cook screwed up my sandwich twice. I always order the Sal Italian sausage with mozzarella and hot and sweet peppers. Well I got a royal when I returned it the brought out a new sandwich wrong it was the same sandwich minus the lettuce and tomatoes but he left the coppicola  and  a bit of lettuce. So he was to lazy to make a new sandwich on top of that it took him 20 minutes to make it with only 3 other people there. So needless to say I will never step back in this location again, I will if I see Chris' truck that way I'll have my food made properly. Normally 5 stars but as long as the have the current cook zero stars. And I've eaten here 100 plus times, so a loyal customer no more.

Let me start by saying I LOVE Naked City Pizza. That being said, I don't think I can come back to this location. I walk in and a short girl with long black hair takes my to go order. Customers come and go, 20 minutes later I'm still standing there. I keep looking over and making eye contact with the girl at the desk who took my order to make sure it wasn't ready. She's there having a long personal conversation with some guy. Finally about 5 minutes later (25 minutes or so later) she walks over to me and says "excuse me sir but are you waiting for something?". Are you serious? You're the one who took my order! So I tell her what I ordered (which was just a simple order of suicide fries) and she's goes and picks up the box that I saw the cook sit down 15 minutes prior and hands it to me. No apologies or anything. Her reply was "well we had a lot of orders I can't remember everyone's face". I'M THE ONLY PERSON STANDING IN THE RESTAURANT BESIDES THE GUY WHOS TAKING THE ATTENTION. AWAY FROM YOU DOING YOUR JOB! If my time isn't valuable to you then I won't bother. Everyone else at Naked City is awesome but it's a shame how one person can make you never want to return to a business again. Well I guess I can still go to the location inside Moon Doggies.

Yelp is my go to for recommendations, but this is my first time writing a review. This was hands down THE worst dining experience I have ever had! I know, I know... I should have listened to the others, so I really have no one to blame but myself, but we had an entertainment coupon and it was on DDD, so how bad could it be, right???  The first red flag should have been the guy alone PASSED OUT in the booth. The server said he was waiting for his party to arrive and acted like it was totally normal for someone to be sleeping, with their mouth wide open in a restaurant. Red flag number 2, besides him, there was only one other family in the restaurant, on a Saturday night at 5:45pm. We ordered our food (1 wee,1 not so wee, 1 salad, and 1 sausage sandwich) and then we waited. Red flag number 3, after we placed our order we had to give our dirty, paper menus to the people next to us that had just say down. I guess they didn't have enough to give them? Weird!!! After waiting 45 minutes we were starting to get really hungry and the restaurant was filling up. We asked about how much longer and the sever said any minute, but that they only had two ovens and there were a lot of orders. She laughed about it like it was a joke and when I said this is not funny, we are starving she said "it's my job to smile" in her snarkiest voice. This is when I started to lose my patience. My 4 year old was starving, (and at this point had eaten all of the snacks I had in my bag) as were the rest of us. When we ordered our food, we were the only table in the restaurant that had no food! The people next to us were already eating and I am pretty sure the guy passed out was not planning on eating. So why then was it taking 45 minutes to get our food!?!?  Finally 15 minutes later our salad came out, but we had no plates. Then one pizza came out, but not the other. The two other tables that came in after us got their pizzas before we got our second pizza and our sandwich!!! So half my family had no food! The other half couldn't eat anyway because they use so much cheese it took forever to cool off enough to be able to eat it. The service was terrible and my husband had to get up four different times to get napkins, knives, extra plates, and a box. The tables are also ridiculous. Every time one of us had to get up we had to move the table to be able to fit. We are regular sized people, but the tables are like picnic tables at a booth and the wood legs block you in. I have never had to move an entire table to be able to get out of my seat. When we were finally done no surprise the bill was wrong. They had said they would take off the sandwich because they messed it up (shocker) but it was still on the bill. As we got in the car to leave we all breathed a sigh of relief that dinner was over. I guess all you can do is laugh about it and of course "yelp" about it. Thanks for reading!
I dont know what people are talking about. Save your time and money, go to Pizza Rock. Service was ok. Margherita pizza was a mockery of that style of pizza. The naked city pizza was ok.
I can't speak for service since I order to go but the food is excellent.  Definitely worth a visit.
Great pizza and service, even with one waitress. It can be a bit on the loud side, if you're interested in a quiet sit-down venue.

The pizza is good and I also like their cheese fries just make sure if you don't like bacon make sure you tell them no bacon because otherwise they will put it on them like everyone I've desire bacon what happen to asking if I would like bacon or not.. Lol anyway it's a nice small place to enjoy a decent piece of pizza , be prepared to wait this is not a place with pizza to go laying around I don't know about you but I like fresh pizza I hate those places with sitting pizza with flies all over, I give this place a lower rating only because the seating is very limited overall it's a nice place with good pizza.
Suicide Fries are so good, but you have to be a fan of the spicy!! The potato fires are also good. Pizza and pizza crust are delish but very greasy because of all the cheese they put on them!

Went there because of the great reviews, but could not see why they were so highly regarded in the first place. 

It says they're open until 3am, I got there around 11pm, and as I'm ordering, the lady tells me to make sure to get my whole order in, so I don't need to come back, because they'll close after my order... Um, OK. I said if my order would keep them from closing, I didn't have to place it, and she tells me it's fine. So I place my order, pay for it, leave a couple dollars tip, and there's not even a thank you. When I come back to pick up my order 15 mins later, it's not all correct, and rather than correcting it, all I get is a half-assed "Sorry dude" and not even a hint of an attempt to make it right. On top of that, the pizza I did receive was hard as bricks, and mostly tasteless.  My wife worked at Chuck E Cheese when she was younger, and commented that even their pizza is better, so do with that what you will.  Overall, this place sucks, and my wife and I will not be returning

Went to dinner on Monday and enjoyed the food. We ordered the chopped salad, wings, seasoned fries and pizza. Our server Joe was very friendly and attentive. Recommend this place for dinner when you're in Vegas.
Had the "Back Home" pizza and it was fantastic! The loaded potato fries were great as well. Waitress was a bit distracted with her friends at another table but overall I'd be back. :)

Pizza was great. The server was great also we ask for well done ahe had to take it back. I wanted a mix drink but they only had beer...so i just got water .and the pizza took up the whole table i had to eat my pizza under the pizza tray..the sauce taste spicey the crust wasnt to thick which at first look at the pictures they look thick but it wasnt

Ate here twice on a weekend Vegas trip.  The weekday lunch of 2 slice & a soda for $6 is as a cheap a lunch as you can find!  The slices are huge.  I had one for lunch & saved the other for my dinner.  We had a salad, 2 kinds of pizza, 3 of the starters and all were very good.
Guinea pizza was good but not the best even if guy fiery says so.. the rebel is the way to go. Awesome beer selection.
Best wings in las vegas also incredible pizza, if you are looking for the perfect wing this is the place to go

I am a avid customer, however my last 3 orders have not been good. I ordered a slice it took overv 25 minutes. second order was a slice and fries my slice was burnt and hard fries overcooked. gave them a third try because I like the food I just ordered fries and once again overcooked. I called TO GIVE THEM FEEDBACK telling them I was unsatisfied with order they claim they would give me a free slice next time without even asking my name. I wont be going there any more, not only was my food messed up, the employees are not friendly at all just asking for order no eye contact, no smile no nothing. I feel like I am ordering from a robot. used to be thumbs up. definitely thumbs down now, not only are they letting there food quality go down, they have no customer service skills anymore either.

This is the second time eating here and the last. Service is bad. Looks like they are crackheads. I bought a chicken finger sub. Bread was old and crusty. The put oil and vinegar on it and sprinkle it with oregano. Not even close to a Buffalo chicken finger sub. They really need to get there shit together! !!

I brought my friends to Naked City Pizza for lunch and was very impressed with the food.. I ordered loaded cheese fries minus the bacon and sour cream.. Absolutely delicious... The pizza is amazing as well!!!! You have to come here for lunch, the prices are great and the food is even better!!!
Pizza is wack. Wtf is the chef back there? Bc they don't know shyt about how to make a  pizza! Sad

After wanting to try this place forever we finally decided to give it a go.. After seeing it on TV & reading all the yelp reviews I couldn't wait! After going to the other location and waiting 20 minutes with nobody greeting us we decided to get up & give the other location a try.. The food was awesome, we got pizza, buffalo dip and fries all of it was bomb! Our server was trying her hardest but they could definitely use another server.. Will probably come back to this location but I would probably order it to go next time.

Unfortunately I don't get to review the pizza. Walked into naked city at 4:30pm on a Monday. Ordered two slices of cheese and was told it'd be five minutes. Sat down, 25 minutes later walked to the counter and asked where the slices were. I was told that they just put the cheese pizza in the oven and it'd be another ten minutes. I advised the people behind the counter that 35 minutes for two slices of cheese was unacceptable and asked for a refund, which was promptly given and I left. 

If a pizza shop sells slices (which not all do, which is fine) then there should always be a pizza on deck. If there isn't, then the workers in front should be aware. Regardless, if it's going to take 35 minutes for two slices of pizza, the customer should be made aware. 

It's a shame. This pizza may have been good, but the service and kitchen work prevented me from even trying it. When I'm served bad food, at least I get food.

The food here is so good. The rebel pizza is amazing! The wings and stuffed mushrooms are definite highlights also. 

The only complaint I have is they took the Philly cheesesteak rolls off the menu and that was one of the best things on the menu. I wish they'd bring em back.

Pizza by the slice was very good. I got the Back Home and pepperoni slices. Staff was friendly, and the local Weiss beer hit the spot.  Atmosphere was quite, but I was here during an off peck time; however the music selection was nice.

My first time at this location, it's still kinda a dive, but much better than the store on Arville. I went in around 4:30 to grab an early dinner and watch some March Madness tournament games! The waitress / front end employee directed me to sit where I wanted, there were only two people there besides me! I took a seat and within a minute or so I had some ice water! I decided on the garlic fries and the Guineas pizza! Both were excellent! The crust on the pie was so perfect ! By the time my food arrived at my table the place had pretty much filled up, with just the one gal working the entire seating area as well as handling take out and phone orders, she was outstanding and I give her a 10 stars out of five! Sadly the wilburs from arizona slimed their way past Xavier in the basketball game, but even that despicable and heartbreaking event didn't ruin my experience! Great food and EXCELLENT service tonight at this location! I recommend everything but uofa sports! FYI this place is right on the corner of Paradise and Naples, it can be a bit tricky to find because Paradise becomes one way at this point and the sign is hard to see while merging, but well worth the possible U-turn you will probably have to make!

Saw this on DDD so I gave it a try
It's not good pizza
Tastes like Dominos or Pizza Hut
I've lost a little faith in Guy
The dough is good but the sauce is bland and the meatball topping seemed like processed over cooked
Blah
I know good pizza
I lived in New Jersey my whole life
NJ/NYC has the best Italian food outside of Italy

I would recommend this place based on the extensive microbrew beer list, delivery service, and the simple cheese pizza we ordered.  Very clean and nice ambiance with nice quiet music. Haven't tried the other types of pizza but definitely will upon the next visit to Las Vegas.  A nice change of pace from the typical cardboard pizza places found today!

Pizza was really good! We ordered the Guinea pig pizza which was so yummy it's a must try. Prices are excellent also. Seating area is tight but it's perfect if you have a small group. I would come back, enjoyed the Sicillian wings also.

Got invited here by one of my chef friends and man it was good. I ordered the sicilian wings which were nothing but delicious and the Chicago pizza which was ok but thats just cuz I'm not a fan of so much peppers. But i also tried the sausage pizza and it was heaven. You wont try pizza like this any where else let me tell you.

There has been a pizza shapes void in my heart after whatsup pizza closed ( $3 for a whole cheese pizza is hard to forget). After my friend heard about naked city we decided to try it out.

We ordered the chicken wing dip, rebel pizza and zeppoles. I was concerned at first about the wing dip because I'm not a blue cheese fan . They do offer ranch as a substitute but the waitress said that the blue cheese taste is no longer noticeable when baked. It was worth the shot, the dish had chunks of chicken and mainly tasted like buffalo sauce. Plus garlic pizza bread was tasty by itself.

The rebel pizza was loaded with tomatoes, sausage and ham. Personally it was a bit salty for my taste but after having a bite of their thick crust and gooey cheese... Oh man.. I knew I would be back.

You HAVE TO get the zeppoles. Warm powdered donuts with chocolate sauce. Do I need to say more? GET IT

Overall, warm cozy environment and good food. What more could you ask for?

Wasn't crazy about the pizza. The soda was by the can without refills for $2! The buns we got were great, but they were burnt on the bottom so we had to take that part off. Got the loaded baked potato fries and those were delicious!  I will come back to try the wings as I heard they were awesome, but unfortunately not for the pizza.

Without a doubt in my top 3 pizza places of all time. The guinea pie is just something you don't find at just any pizza place, and my goodness those meatballs! You really feel the comfort and love. The suicide fries are the best french fries I have ever had. The service is good and it's just a simple place to try some delicious food. Anytime I'm in Vegas you will catch me there.

I heard that the pizza is amazing here, so I decided to take my family out to try it out and I was turned away by the staff. There was a gentleman that was ahead of me also got the same treatment. There was a few ppl seating and plenty of places to seat but the young girl  said that it was going to be an hour and half wait because she didn't have any openings. I looked around and was confused. I decided to take my family to the location off Arvile where I was treated with the up most respect and the young lady that was working the counter was able to handle multiple customers and tasks without sacrificing customer service. The pizza was amazing!  Down side is the Arvile location is very small compared to the Paradise location but with this type of customer service I don't mind at all.

We had 22 people. The waitress looked like she was going to faint when we walked in (1.5 hrs prior to closing). Everything was great tasting, especially the wings. The waitress was awesome. She really did a great job taking care of all of us. Highly recommend!

I've been to the location on arville st and wanted to give it a try. Ordered stuffed "banana" peppers and a few slices of pizza. We were the only ones in the place and they didn't seem busy at all. So, our slices came out first and they were cooked with the toppings we ordered but must have sat there because they were only warm. They obviously cooked the pizza and it was done first and just sat there. Strike one. Look, people, pizza and this cuisine isn't brain surgery. It should've been hot. The stuffed peppers (2 for 9.95 and they were small and shitty) were NOT banana peppers. They were green, not banana peppers. Little filing in them with a slip of ranch on the plate. Strike two. My girl asked for garlic to put on the pizza and she brings garlic POWDER. See pic. Strike three. Won't be back. Don't recommend to anyone.

Rebel pizza is a must kick it up a notch with bacon! The Victor and hamslaw sandwich are a must have. The bread is on point nice and warm with just the right amount of crunch! Both pack a mouth full of flavor multiple layers of flavors. You won't see all the original menu items from the original shop on on Desert inn & Arville. But a great way to shake up the menu. This location is family friendly kids are able to come in this location. Great chicken wings and fingers. For a new twist try the Italian wings or fingers. They also serve local beer a great way to support local companies

I've been waiting two years to try this place!!  I really wanted to try the philly egg rolls their online menu says they have. They discontinued them ok. I ordered the pizza egg rolls, people with me ordered steak sandwhich, and garlic Rolls. 45 effing minutes for this and I had to go ask what the hold up was!!!! The rolls were burnt to a crisp on the bottom the pizZa rolls were not even cooked and they steak sandwhich was cold. Customer service was nonexistent, infact she was rude from the get go. She clearly hated her Job and people such a waste of money and time.

I seen this dive on Triple D. Started out going to the wrong place the one on Arville not meant for kids, but the were courteous and pointed us in the right direction to the place on Paradise. We drove by it the first time. It is kind of hidden but on one way street on left hand side, and if you take the first left to go around the block, then technically you're there, just need to pull in liquor store parking lot. Anyway, we walked in, maybe a bad sewage day, but it smelled really bad and it almost turned us around, but we stuck it out. We ordered the Guinea Pie, it was awesome, crust was amazing. The sizes are strange, but waitress very courteous and explained the sizes to us, so we ordered the half wee and it still took us 3 days to eat the rest. My son ordered couple of cheese slices, was so good that when he brought it home, he actually ate his leftovers. My opinion, service was no less or more than I would I would expect anywhere else. The food we ordered was awesome. I would totally recommended it!! Oh yea it is a Buffalo Bills place on Sundays or Game Days
I live half way across the country and Naked City is a must do destination as anything in Vegas for me. That Guinea pie is indescribably good and the buffalo wings were awesome
Absolutely awe inspiring pizza. If you are looking to break away from the standard pepperoni cheese and sauce style pie, this is your best bet.

We had the chopped salad and Naked City pizza. The salad was to die for with a combination of spinach and arugula, lots of cheese and meat. It was huge and a meal in itself. Then we ordered pizza. It was Sicilian style and really good. The sausage was the stand out and, put all together, was the trifecta of crust, sauce and toppings!! One of the best pizza meals I've ever eaten. 

You do have to get past the "joint" atmosphere and the fact that none of the beer is on tap but definitely worth it. A must try in Vegas!!!

We had the seasoned fries with cheddar and mozzarella cheese. Very tasty. And dinner was a slice each of pepperoni pizza. We were having dinner on the late side so we opted not to fill up too much. Not too crazy about the soda cans with no refills. Great service with quick food delivery.

Extremely long wait for what might be one of the best pizzas I've ever had.... Garlic buns were amazing, sauce was a bit spicy and really nummy!. Pizza was so good, but we over ordered and we'll be eating leftovers for days!

Definitely recommend, as long as you aren't in a rush. Had our good been slightly quicker, and if they had fountain beverages to offer free refills, it would have been 5 stars!
Service was poor and we waited over an hour for a pie. Food was decent but not everything it was hyped up to be.
First time I tried the one on the east side. Not sure why but I like the pizza from the west side shop better than the east side place. Still worth trying a lot better than the national chains.

Was disappointed upon our first visit to this Diners Drive ins and Dives featured pizza place.  After order was taken it took forever to get our order.  Server told us there was a new cook in training and apologized for the delay.  I asked why our salad could not be served prior to the Pizza. Finally salad was brought to table.  Only lettuce tomatoes and dressing don't know why it took so long.  Pizza ordered was one featured on DD and D "Guinea Pie".  Tasted good.  Was like stuffed shells on pizza crust.  Very rich.  With the small number of people in the restaurant at the time I was extremely disappointed in the time it took to get our order.
One of the best pizza places in town if your craving a homemade pan crust!!!! Of course their signature Guinea pie is killer, my favorite is extra ricotta, ham, and onion!!!!

Atmosphere - simple. Tables are low so it is hard to move in and out from under them.

Were the only ones in the shop at 5:30 on a Sunday but by the time we left it got busy. 

Food - shared the chicken wing dip. Very good. Nice chunks of chicken and the cheese to buffalo sauce ratio is good. A little greasy but the super fluffy and soft dough you dip it in is from the angels :)

Also had a slice of cheese pizza ( we do this across many pizza platforms to gauge quality ). A good mix of cheese flavors. Cannot go wrong with it.

Shared the 1/3 sheet guinea pie. Not overly garlicy and a good helping of their ricotta on the fluffy dough. The meat is also not super spicey (which I enjoy). A quality pizza with good ingredients. Cannot find this in a typical cheese or pepperoni joint.

The location is not premium. The interior is simple, rustic, appropriate for an establishment labeled Naked City Pizza. The staff is friendly, with server Shauna being knowledgeable, courteous and caring.
  Let's talk food. The foundation for every great pizza is crust and sauce. NCP does it right! This crust is not thin but not too thick. It is baked to perfection, having a crunchy bottom and chewy, delicious center. The sauce is genuine, freshly made and absolutely amazing. 
  Being a pizza connoisseur for thirty-plus years, I have consumed more pizza than the average consumer, I must confess "The Rebel" pizza is definitely in my top three of all time. It is incredibly delicious!
  Should you wish to begin your visit with a fantastic appetizer, I highly recommend the "Meatball Skillet." Phenomenal meatballs and that amazing sauce!
  If you appreciate authentic, excellent Italian fare you owe it to yourself, give this place a visit and enjoy!

The pizza was absolutely amazing. We got the Guinea pie, and the spinach was way better than the meatballs. We got the in-between size and it was way too much for two people, even taking it home we didn't get through it in time. 
I think we came on an off night, the website said they were opened for a long time but the server seemed very hesitant about what the chef would make and had to check before everything we inquired about. She was super sweet, though!
We'd definitely be back to try another pie.

Excellent food. The garlic rolls are delicious, soft rolls with gooey cheese and hearty portions of garlic! 

We had the Italian sausage sandwich which was delicious and nicely spicy. The pasta with butter, parm and pepper was delicious. A little dry but probably because we ordered to go. 

Small cheese pizza had 6 large square slices and my daughter, the cheese pizza expert was very happy with her dinner. 

The cheesecake was delicious. It's a softer cheesecake, with scrumptious raspberry syrup and graham cracker crust.

Some of the best pizza I have ever eaten. Truly delicious!! We had the Guinea Pie and loved it. Great crust, just the right amount of toppings and the garlic white sauce was insane. We also had the Suicide fries which were too hot for me, but my husband enjoyed them. We finished the meal with the tiny donuts. Those are an absolute MUST. $5 and you get a giant bag of them with chocolate dipping sauce. My only complaint would be that the service left something to be desired, as there seemed to only be one employee working. That did not hinder my experience thought. We will definitely be coming back!!

Pizza was very good but I would say try it once and no need to return. The wings were awful and the poutine fries were overly salted. We ordered pizza and 20 minutes after we put in the order the waitress said it will 90 more minutes until it is ready. We asked to cancel order but she said it was already in oven. It came out much sooner and was very good. But again, I would never return.

We saw this place on the Food Network. Being Guy's recommendation and close to UNLV, we had to check it out. 

The Suicide Fries were great. We can handle our heat, and they were definitely spicy. This is not for the faint of heart. 

The pizza was meh. It was oily, and the sauce tasted like pure tomato paste. I won't be back here for a pie any time soon.

I hate to write this because I used to like Naked City a lot. Now I think they're just too busy to pay attention to quality.
I just ordered delivery through Postmates. It's late at night and I haven't eaten since breakfast. I'm very hungry. So you can imagine that I am anticipating my food like crazy.

I get my pizza an what a disappointment. The dough is undercooked and the cheese is barely cooked. I just tossed everything in the garbage because it's barely edible.
I've ordered from this place before and I've never had such bad quality. Usually the pizzas are well cooked and they advertise "cup and char" pepperoni, meaning it's cooked enough for the pepperoni to get crispy on the edges. You can see from the photos that the pepperoni is barely cooked, the middle is just bland and mushy, and the dough isn't even cooked through.

Kid friendly restaurant in the front.  Bar in the back. Same great tasting pizza like the one on Arville. The cashier comes to the table and take your order. Near UNLV and the airport. 10 wings comes with fries and carrot sticks. I love that the Ranch dressing was in a squeeze bottle like ketchup. So you get plenty!  Always make a stop here while in Vegas. Cheap eats!!!  You get your money's worth. Trust me!!!

WARNING: If you're a tourist who saw this place on "Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives" and you are thinking about coming here, please think again.

NOTE: If you're a local and want to check this place out, please do so at your own peril.

The reason I make this distinction is that I saw a cab pull up with some diners, and I can only surmise that they were wary tourists who saw this place on "Triple D" and thought they'd try it out. If that's you, please save your cab fare (or at least spend it on a GOOD "Triple D" place, like Four Kegs) and go somewhere else. There are PLENTY of great restaurants in this city, but this ain't one of them.

I've never given a one-star review, and I'm sad to give this one, but it sure is warranted. My husband and I arrived around 6:15 on a Saturday. There was only one other table of customers, and we had to be somewhere by 8, so we thought we were in good shape. The waitress came by and took our order, and I should have known we were in trouble when it took us 10 minutes to get our first beers. I watched the waitress pour our drafts, and she was having a hard time with it. How hard is it to pour a draft?! And she brought them out one at a time, telling us she was "still pouring" the other one. (?!)

Then, we waited an hour to get our order: a "wee" portion of poutine and a "wee" Naked City pizza. I love poutine, but I'm not sure how mozzarella cheese and rosemary figure into the mix. Gravy on fries, yes, but the rest was just weird. And our pizza was certainly nothing to write home about. My husband is a professional cook, and he swears they used pre-packaged dough and canned or frozen toppings (pepperoni, sausage, and green olives). My palate is not that discerning, but I know a Tony's pizza knockoff when I taste it. SO disappointing!

The wait was annoying, but it also didn't help that I had an Entertainment book coupon that I was going to use on the poutine, and it wasn't applied to the bill. (A whopping $4 savings, but still...) We didn't get our food until 7:30 and we had to scram to make our engagement, so I didn't stick around to quibble over the bill. I also didn't stick around to eat much of the food, because it wasn't much worth it anyway. One piece of "pizza" and I was done. Thank God we only ordered a small...

The place filled up in the 90 minutes we were there, and I can only feel sorry for the other diners in the place -- especially the tourists who I hope don't judge our town by this sorry dining experience. I'm writing this review 9 hours later, and I just hope they're still not there waiting for their food...

I have been to the naked city before on arville, so I decided to give the paradise location a try. The chicken wings taste as good as if you were in buffalo, ny! I had the stinger pizza and it was amozing!!!

I'd give them 4.5 stars just because it seemed to take a longgggg time for the food to come out, and they didn't seem that busy. When the food finally arrived, it was well worth the wait!

Go to naked city for the best wings in town! Buffalo Wild Wings cannot even begin to compare!

Not real poutine (beef gravy with cheese curds....) but very tasty.  Naked salad was outstanding with mounds of delicious roasted peppers.  Wings are big and juicy. Medium buffalo sauce is really mild but very authentic like Anchor Bar. Naked City Pizza was clearly our favorite, excellent crust, pepperoni was juicy with curled edges, marinated meatballs were spicy. Great value and excellent flavor.

First time at this hidden little spot and we will definitely be back! Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Pizza was great! The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is that I think they were a little skimpy on the toppings. Pizza could have used a little more pepperoni and mushrooms. Although that is getting a little picky.

Love love love the food!!! I had the "Ma" burger. Its $11 but the best burger I've ever had! Would eat it again! I was scared when we walked in. It is really a dump inside and out. It was dead, we were the only people there the entire time. The waitress sat in the seat next to like we were friends(some people like this. I personally feel it is bad business and it frankly pisses me off. I don't know you and your in my bubble). Only complaints are that they served can soda, didn't even offer a glass of ice, the fries are amazing but had no salt, and about half way through this gigantic burger ( have to use a knife and fork to eat it) the seasonings in the meat become way over powering. But just ask for more lettuce slaw and your good to go, if you even finish it!

I've traveled near and far, and have consumed pizza all around the globe.  Pizza is one of my favorite foods and while I wish I could claim to be on the paleo kick, Whole30, or one of these other low carb meal plans, pizza gets me EVERY TIME! So when my Chicago native husband said, babe you gotta try this place, I gave it a shot.  

Ok seriously folks this is some good pizza! The crust is buttery and flavorful, the toppings are good quality, and the mozzarella is super fresh. I know there's all sorts of cuisine to consume in Vegas, but this is worth trying while you're visiting.  Bon appetit!

Pizza here is the bomb. No matter what kind you order! I'm vegetarian so they have always catered to me. I've even had kitchen staff make me things that weren't on the menu that they invented just for me. Lol. The pizza is buffalo style. Which makes it different from all the rest you'll find in Vegas. Only issue I had was it made me fat! But what else do you expect if you eat it as often as I did??  Well now I moved to Cali, lost 25 lbs.. but still miss it! Yum! I'll be back in 2 weeks for just 1 slice.

The reason i give a 3 is because of the differences between service and great food i will agree that the pizza is fenomenal and quite large for a we type pizza spot so small but just like that is where you find quality food. Now the service not great for me and my husband and company we were not greeted with the warmth welcome and didn't  even explain the menu. The small size can feed the whole family. She could guided us not to order so much.   if you are in town and looking for good pizza come eat here.

Wasn't crazy thrilled with the pizza, but the salad was delicious and the "buns" were good if the bottoms weren't burnt.  I'll return, but to try other options on the menu, I head their chicken wings were absolutely delicious!
Wow - pizza dough is probably the best I've ever had. We had the paesano and it was absolutely amazing! Ratio of toppings to cheese to crust was perfect.

We tried the signature pizza at this place called the Guinea Pie. It was very good. I am a pizza traditionalist so it was exactly my favorite but I really appreciated its freshness and the combination of flavors. What makes me give this place a five was the outstanding service. The woman that served us was friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!

Great food, nice atmosphere, excellent value.  BBQ wings, garlic fries, stuffed mushrooms are a must before you dig into some of the best pizza ever.  Unique style, not New York thin, not Chicago dish, not Italian crispy thin, its pizza Buffalo style.  Incredible selection of bottled beers, something for everyone.  Highly recommended!

We called in the to-go order at 6:15pm and a nice lady answered, took our order. There were two of us wanting to eat. We ordered a 1/4 Guinea pizza and a 10 pc wings-medium heat. Maybe this is just a good day to go. She told us 20-25 minutes, but we waited some extra because people here and on other review sites said they were very slow. We got there at maybe 6:45 or 6:50. The pizza and wings were ready to go. Not sure how long they had sat there but still were warm. So it had been ready on time. The restaurant was not crowded at all. So they did well on the service time.
We got home and had our wings, which were hot. I am used to heat, I do eat jalapenos and 'hot' wings so not a big deal. But if they didn't mess up, and if that is how hot and spicy there medium sauce is, then beware if you cannot handle the heat. Wings are the 'wet' style, so have plenty of napkins ready.
The guinea pizza was very good. We had sausage added as an extra, and I would recommend this. It is a white sauce pizza, garlic, cheese and meatballs too. Very good. 
For two grown men, the 1/4 pizza was enough food. We got too much, and ate too much, by getting the wings. As for there not being crowds, and there not being a wait time, maybe we got lucky on the time and day we went. Not sure. But the place looked clean and the lady that got our pizza was super nice.
I would go again.

I've always really liked the pizza from here, but wanted to give a heads up on ordering through Seamless.  They are listed on the Seamless webpage with the correct menu and address,  and I got a confirmation text after paying that the order was accepted, but when my husband got to the restaurant to pick it up, the restaurant said they didn't have anything and hadn't ever heard of seamless. They said they called the owner who also said he hadn't heard of them.  Not sure what's going on there.  Seamless gave me a refund, so it's fine, but very odd.

Terrible service, the waitress who was the ONLY waitress could have cared less if this was our first time here, pizza was meh, I've had better, given the fact that it was crowded, I thought the idea of an appetizer was that it came before your entree, not here we got out pizza first how backwards is that!!!!! NEVER COMING BACK HERE AGAIN!!!!!!!
Place was pretty good. I wasn't a huge fan of their style of pizza but I was a fan of the garlic buns and garlic fries. Both extremely delicious. The ranch was also top notch!

Tourists must go! We are from Cali and We love naked city pizza! Been to both locations and both are great! Amazing pizza! We recommend the naked city-pepperoni, sausage, sweet peppers, onions and olives. We also recommend their loaded potato fries. We have had their suicide fries in the past and they are delicious but HOT!!! If you like spicy and wing sauce you will love this place! Haven't tried their sandwiches because we always want the pizza but I am sure everything is great here!!

Pizza was bland and over oily. Did not enjoy eating either of the two pizzas I got. I even got the while pizza featured on food network and I was not impressed at all. Subpar service, the girl was on her phone at the register. The buffalo chicken dip was penominal but I won't be returning.

One of the best pizza spots to me as a person that has lived in Vegas for many years... I read the previous comments and besides the negative ones I decided to go in..... BEST DECISION EVER!!!! It was like a High class restaurant with low prices man they had me at the bendy straws haha... I loved every minute of that experience and Natasha made it even better. The pizza was A+ and did I mention the fries? Holy Jesus guy who died on the cross them fries were spectacular... Had the loaded potato fries which were so damn delicious and had the garlic Parmesan which was so tasty... I felt like fat bastard after eating all that food I tried to eat it all... Best part was that when I got home I had the itis and knocked out completely... Hell yeah naked city pizza was the real MVP TODAY!!!!!

20 minutes for 2 slices.  You get a lot for your money.  It is good we it comes out.
If you like thick crust pizza, you will like this place. It's more Sicilian.
Service is very casual and friendly.

Hidden in a very nondescript building next to a bar... we were super lucky to find a parking spot late on a Friday night after flying in to town from the east coast. It was well past midnight eastern time and approaching midnight Vegas time but we had to try Naked City. I was on a mission.

Since we hadn't eaten all day, the plan was to try multiple items and we definitely achieved that goal. Shannon, our server, was friendly and professional and took care of us even though it was clear we were over ordering for just the two of us.

We started with an orange flavored ice tea and a craft beer to wet our appetite.
Then, to the infamous suicide fries! Spicy and delicious!
Garlic fries with extra garlic? Yes, I believe we'll have that too! Unfortunately, it still needed more garlic! Or, could it be that we damaged our taste buds on the suicide fries?
A chopped salad without garlic or hot peppers to round out the meal? Why not? It was super tasty, with the addition of a bit of salt and pepper. 
A huge Guinea Pie to enjoy? El Freakin' Yummo in a uniquely-garlicky-kind-of-way. This pillowy-soft flavorful pizza has to be tried!

All in all, we had a great meal and leftovers for a few more!
Thanks Naked City!

This place sucks the one on arville is way better... The way I perceived my food was that, not one person who worked so hard with all the prep and cooking involved cared.. My food was so bland I got poutine fries() and the hot chicken tender sandwich (fail) every thing just lacked that extra bit of seasoning  service was phenomenal might I add! And the water was so refreshing love their ice! But I won't becoming back to this location

I ordered two orders of wings and paid over 50 dollars for my food. I asked for extra ranch and blue cheese dressing. When I ordered wings I assumed I would get dressing with them. They forgot to put any dressing at all! So I didn't get and ranch or blue cheese or the extra I asked for. It was hard to enjoy my wings. This place can be forgetful so just double check your orders. The pizza and wings are good just wish I got what I asked for and paid for.

This is my second time here.  The pizza was delicious and the wing dip is worth all the calories.  The waitress was overwhelmed and she still managed not to go nuts.  They should have had more than one server.   If this place was back home we would go all the time.

I ate at Naked City back in Nov. 2014 & cannot believe I didn't write a review or that it's been a year since I have eaten there. Loved this place. Went in with a group of 8 people. We ordered various things like the crazy Ham slaw sandwich and a "wee" order of fries, Poutine, The Naked Salad, Beef on Wek sub, House-Made Italian Sausage Sub, Stuffed banana peppers, Margarita pizza, Guinea's Pie, Paesano Pizza, Back Home Pie, & a couple of other items I didn't get the names of. It was all great food. Their "wee" pizzas are not so wee. Definitely enough for a couple of meals if not 3. I cannot wait to go back here & I was looking for my yelp review & couldn't find it hence to the writing of it now. Better late than never.

I Want my money back

I got a turkey sub that included the additional cost of cheese. Fine but they put shredded cheddar no American slices. I was offered provolone and motz. I asked for mayo, onion, lettuce, banana pepper. They don't have banana peppers. They DO have "hot peppers" so I ordered those. I found them on the menu myself. Canned jalapeño and pepperoncini is what the "hot peppers" consisted of. And the cheese was stale!! The shredded cheddar!! If you don't want to make subs then don't put them on the menu!! 

I was also watching the waitress have a hard time entering my order into the POS system. She said "I have to type a paragraph" I didn't know if she was mad or not. Sorry the sub only comes with bread meat lettuce and tomato. No mayo! No cheese! Nothing else, so yeah people are going to alter their order because wtf kind of sub is that? I'm from buffalo and I seriously don't know how they could sell a sub like this. Also I've worked at Jim's steakout for several years when I was 16-20 and had no problems with using a cash register POS. 

back to the nasty sub I got...
They didn't cut the sub in half and it was seriously worse than subway. I'm not even eating it. I want to go back in and return it but the girls are busy (6-7 tables, 2 servers, 1 food runner) and I don't want to get yelled at. I waited 22 mins and paid $13 with a pop for this crap and I want my money back. I really don't even think the full sub is 12" it looks more like 9 or 10. 

Pizza at this location is ok but arville overall is much better food wise. I've had a chicken finger sub from the other location and pizza that was good. 

One star for the pizza which if I was you I'd order from Arville instead. Good-Luck
Via postmates delivers to Bally's hotel rooms.  I'm a CT/NY pizza snob 10/10 really good pizza!

Omg.  That was excellent pizza.   We ordered a not so wee pizza so we could bring some home, but we couldn't stop eating it.   We also ordered the poutine fries.  The gravy was also amazing.   We will be making this a regular stop whenever we are in Las Vegas.

Came here today and I am so amazed at how delicious everything was. We ordered a Caesar salad (10/10), Chicken wings (10/10) and pizza of course which was absolutely a (10/10). Our server was friendly and great customer service. If you're in Vegas, this is a must to try. You will not be disappointed.
Pretty solid pizza place. They do not have fountain drinks, or they would have received a 5 star. Cands of soda are 2 bucks a pop. Besides that, cool place.

I love the pizza and food at Naked City, and I was sorry to see the tavern close.  But people need to be warned.  Wait time can be extreme.  With only four other parties in the restaurant, we waited more than an hour and a quarter for the one pizza we ordered to be brought out.  It was worth it, but I was prepared for it.  We also resorted to helping ourselves to plates and flatware.

Other problems include the downgrading of beer, moving away from a solid collection of craftbeer to a handful of options.  Also a serious downgrading of the menu.  The better sandwiches are now gone.  This isn't the place that rocked us, even given the awkward location, a couple of years ago.  We'll still return, not as eager, and knowing it may be a long wait.

5 star food, 2 star limited menu, 1 star service.

Garlic Buns: they look like garlic, cheese cinnamon buns; the filling is wrapped in the dough, then rolled into spirals and served with marinara. I didn't care for the sauce; it still had that "aluminum" taste (or maybe it's just me) that most places are able to mask a little better.

Pepperoni pizza: we ordered the 1/4 sheet, the smallest pizza they serve, and it was still a little too much for the two of us. I really liked the toppings and the crust; the crust was chewy, buttery, and soft, the pepperoni were insanely good and got that little bit of crisp around the edges. I almost bought some pepperoni to take home, but it was something insane, like $10 for a pint. Yikes.

The only tiff I had about the service was that the garlic buns and the pizza arrived within a moment of one another. I hate not having any time to enjoy my appetizer before my entree comes. It takes away from the appetizer. Everything was good, but not great. 

Pros:
Cost effective. 
Good pizza. 

Cons: 
The furniture was a bit wobbly?

My husband and I are visiting from out of town. He saw this pizza place on TV and was so excited to try it. We got there at 1pm on a monday and were told they were full when we could see 3 empty tables and all the window seats were open. They told us to go to the other location and they would have a dining room, they didn't, which is a dark gross bar. We had a baby with us. Needless to say we didn't have lunch and won't be trying this place again. Oh we had 8 very hungry people, not just two. Very poor customer service

Our recent trip to Vegas consisted of two dining experiences here and both were wonderful!!! The loaded fries and chopped salad were great but the pizza is to die for!!!  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars, the waitress on our second evening acted like we were a bother and she was annoyed the entire time we were there.  We will be heading back the next time we are in town

So, after trying Naked City Pizza at their original location on the other side of town, and having visions of the Guinea Pie dancing through my head ever since, I decided to try their new location on Paradise Rd.

Unlike its sister store, this venue does not share its interior with a dive bar; this is purely a pizza restaurant.  There is no smoking, and no bar.  They don't serve hard alcohol, just beer and wine.  When you enter, the friendly staff at the counter ask if you prefer to dine in or take out.  If dining in, they seat you in their small cluster of tables and provide waitress service.  If takeout, you place and pay for your order at the register and wait until it is ready.

The space is pleasantly appointed, but it lacks character.  It just feels sterile, somehow.  I guess you could hang out here with your friends for a while, but for some reason it lacks that comfortable hang-out vibe that fun restaurants and bars have.  Note, however, that they just opened a few weeks ago, so as they settle in to the space, perhaps that will evolve.

So the important question is: did the great Guinea Pie pizza survive the transplant to the new location?  Or is it a pale imitation of the original?

I am pleased to report that it is just as good as I remember it.

They also have a nice selection of microbrew beers; I was driving, so I didn't get to try any, but it looked promising.  

The parking lot is a bit of a mess; the spaces are angled backwards from Paradise Rd, so you have to circle around the corner to the entrance on Naples Drive (or, you could pull into a space backwards, I suppose).  Also, they share the lot with Office Bar next door, so it can get quite full.

After having awful tasting, overpriced meals on the strip we decided it was time to venture to high reviewed places off the strip.  Naked City Pizza fit the bill and we decided to stop by for dinner.  

Parking is a little odd here...don't try to park out front, it just won't work.  We watched two guys make a 323 point turn trying to get in and then back out when they realized it wasn't going to happen.  There is plenty of space available in the back.

As a lover of all foods spicy, the suicide fries instantly stood out.  We decided to do a full order of them and then a quarter sheet Guinea Pie.  We got some drinks as well and waited for our order.

The fries came out first...they were spicy.  I absolutely love all spicy food, but the habanero suicide sauce was almost too much for me to handle.  It was amazing.  I was sweating in places on my face that I didn't know could sweat...like right under my temples...it was crazy.  It took a while, but I built up a decent enough tolerance and was able to enjoy around half of them.  They were way too much for my girlfriend to handle.  These were amazing, anyone who loves really spicy food must try them out.

The pizza was good too!  The meatballs were really tasty, the cheese all tasted great, and the white garlic sauce tied it all together really nicely.  The quarter sheet was the perfect size for two, and we could have easily fed a third between the fries and the quarter sheet...this was a welcome change from the awful prices and small portions we were used to on the strip.

Overall it was a great meal.  Easily one of the best I've had in Las Vegas.  I'll be recommending this place to family and friends for a long time and look forward to coming back myself.

The slice of pepperoni pizza was good but got cold to soon.. if I ordered it earlier or order at the place. 

Chop salad is very good and just the dressing on the side. It's is a large salad and finely chopped but delicious. Enough to free one person when your hungry !!

Would have loved to try this place.  Went there on Wednesday night with a group of a total of 20 people. Place had seating, but they didn't have enough cheese to make any pizza.  So we went to neighboring pizza joint "Joe's NY Pizza."

The back home is to die for. I really like the guinea pie but when you want a normal pizza with red sauce, this one is the ticket. I'm not going to be able to eat pizza anywhere else in Vegas without feeling like I'm just wasting calories!

Good food, conveniently located next to three LGBTQ spots (Piranha, Free Zone, and QUADZ), a dispensary (The Grove), a punk rock bar (Double Down Saloon) and your typical neighborhood bar (Office Bar), if any of those places are what you're looking for. The service isn't exactly warm, but when you think about the crazies that probably wonder in there that they have to deal than I get it.
The pizza was crazy good and the beers awesome!! Chef Chris amazing Absolute must eat restaurant.

Nice crispy pizza crust, nice selection of craft beers on tap and decent cheap prices. This was my first visit to this location and I was as pleased with it as i was with the other location. The inside is nice but it does look like an office building on the outside. I'll be back for sure

One of my favorite places. Amazing pizza, and the poutine is a super unexpected, fantastic addition to the menu. A very chill environment. Wonderful food and worth the trip away from the strip if you are visiting.
This place is NOT open until 3am like it states. I was so disappointed when I showed up at 1250am and it was closed

I don't usually do 5 star ratings but my wife and I had a great experience here. We showed up on a Tuesday night about an hour before closing. The server fretted us and let us sit where we liked. It was a late Tuesday night so the place was empty. Cozy little spot, easy to miss if your not paying attention. We got a menu then a few minutes later placed our order. We had a half sheet Back Home pizza, order of wings, seasoned fries and some garlic bread. The food did take a little while to come out but I knew it was for a reason. Everything was absolutely delicious and fresh. We ended up staying past closing hours because my wife's mother wanted to meet us after she got off work and they were completely fine with it. Great pizza joint, will definitely return.

Heard about this place a few days ago and decided to check it out today. It wasn't busy at all. We ordered the wing dip which was delicious. Chicken wing pieces mixed with cheese and other ingredients with a side of grilled flatbread. That was $10. We asked what the lunch specials were and got the 2 slices and a drink for $7 which was a great deal considering it only took one of the huge slices to get me full. We ordered the Guinea pizza. At first I wasn't a fan of the ricotta but the more I ate it, the more I could taste all the flavors which made a great combination. The server was so nice and helpful. I'll definitely be back!

They are soo inconsistent with the quality of their food and service speed is horrible. I stopped for a couple of pepperoni slices and beer... waited approx 30 minutes for my slices, not to bad especially if its fresh. My slices looked like they took 2 old plain cheese slices that had been sitting around, threw new cheese on it and placed pepperoni on it to create my pepperoni slices!! And it wasn't even heated up all the way... cheese was slightly melted but not golden like most fresh pizzas are, pepperoni was cupped but definitely not cooked or charred like a fresh pizza .. and one of the slices looked like they put half cup n char, half Hormel pepperoni on it cause they were larger in size, thinner, and flat compared to the regular cup n char they use!! Only reason i ate it was because i was starving and the wait was 1 1/2 - 2 hours and i didnt want to wait. A family walked in and ordered a pizza, took them 2 hours to get their pizza and their kids sat in their car that long waiting for it. The bartender gave them their money back out of his own tip money because he thought it was ridiculous for the wait also!! The Cashier told the family they only had 1 cook and they get overwhelmed during the UNLV Home basketball games for carry out. If they know this, they should hire more people... this is unacceptable by all standards!!

This place might be good if you go in person, but takeout was AWFUL. Garlic fries = inedible.  I ordered a beef sandwich with provolone and sweet peppers. I got home and it was plain dry beef on a dry roll with nothing else. Inedible. Totally unimpressed and will not go or order from naked city again.
Delicious pizza and great service, best pizza in Vegas in my opinion. The Guinea Pie is bomb.

DON'T WAIST YOUR TIME!. went there on Monday June 22, 2015. ordered a Italian Beef Sandwich 55 Minutes later it was still not at my table. so I asked the waitress how much longer ...she said there was still 3 orders ahead of me and they did not even start making it yet & then said "I told you it would be a while"...So I Left, went  around the corner to Capriottis and 7 minutes later had my sandwich . had the food there before food was just ok. will not go back again

Had the Paesano & Guinea Pie, Poutine fries and mild wings. I love food, busted a couple nuts. I'll be back...anyone who complains about slow service has to realize it takes time to cook your food. Like I mean, want your shit out raw or what? Keep up the great work guys.

Food is good. Portions are big. Service is great. What more can I ask for? I'll definitely be back! Oh and not exactly a deal breaker but they only have green olives! I've never heard of a pizza place that doesn't have black olives! Also love that they serve beer from the Ellis Island brewery!

First time here for lunch today. We were excited to give this place a try after seeing pics and reading the reviews. Especially after reading they were on DDD on Food Network (one of my faves)! Started off with the poutine and meatballs. The poutine was okay (but not as good as Lola's or Blind Pig) and so was the meatball appetizer. They were out of the NY style pizza dough so we ordered the Sicilian. I'd rate the pizza 4 out of 5, but the starters were closer to 3.5. We'd probably come back for the pizza but try other things on the menu. 

Service was good. There was only 1 server and she had to tend to a large party, plus 2 other tables, but it wasn't too bad. 

Kind of in a weird location and I probably wouldn't feel safe going here at night, unless I was with a group.

We went there last night and were very disappointed. There was one young lady working and running the entire place. She was taking orders over the phone, handling take outs, tending to the tables, and being a hostess. It makes me wonder if she was also making the pizzas in the back. We waited 15 minutes to be seated without ever being acknowledged. There were four other people waiting and she kept walking past us as if we weren't all standing there. We ended up leaving and going elsewhere.
Whoever manages the place is not very good at his/her job. 
It was a waste of time.

Great food...pizza, wings, fingers, salads, garlic rolls. Cute little shop, very quaint, casual ambiance. Great pizzas and they're all phenomenal. This place is home to cup-n-char pepperoni...need I say more?? 

So what makes this pizza so awesome? Well, everything basically. But really, it's because these pizzas come from the heart & soul of the owner & chef. I've read numerous articles and watched him on tv and he really does have a great story. He enjoyed great success as the youngest executive chef in MGM history. But it seems he gave it all up for... pizza!!!! How can you not love and respect that??? Pizza!!! Buffalo, NY style pizza! And he does it unlike anyone else. First of all he's making everything he can from scratch. Ricotta cheese. Meatballs. Sausage and so much more. So you know these are top notch, high quality toppings. The sauce is very understated. It's not dripping, it's not gloppy, overpowering everything...it's just good ol' back home sauce that's fuses everything together in perfect culinary harmony. 
But none of that means anything without the right crust. And this is the right crust. It's square. It's crispy everywhere it needs be and soft & chewy everywhere else. It's light & airy but hearty...it needs to support & hold all those delicious toppings. Here are a few of our favs; the Guinea. That house made fresh ricotta, house made meatballs, spinach mozzarella and a white garlic sauce. And the chicken finger pizza. The what??? Yea, I said chicken. And then I said fingers. They take their amazing chicken fingers...I order mine Sicilian style...and they put them on a pizza with blue cheese and mozzarella. The flavor is non stop. Every bite is better than the last. And then my other fave. The rebel. This is my everything pizza. Cup-n-char pepperoni, in house Italian sausage, ham, salami, marinated tomatoes, fresh basil, mozzarella & red sauce. The first time we ordered it we asked for no ham. They didn't listen. And we were so glad they didn't! It's a great pie! Don't skip any of those toppings. 
You can not go wrong here.

Great things come in small packages! This hole in the wall provided us with some of the best pizza we've had in a long time! They also carry a large selection of beer but it's the pizza that will have us going back. The wait staff were friendly and took care of our party of 16 like we were old friends! We ordered a pepperoni, a veggie, and a meat lovers and had more than enough to go around!

I'm currently a bloated cow, because this place was all everyone told us it would be and more! Great wait staff providing us guidance on what to get, and just excellent overall!! We had some excellent garlic buns, which are literally oversized garlic and cheese looking cinnamon buns! Then to make my gut bust they brought us our 1/2 sheet of rebel pizza! Woof! I couldn't be happier that we made our walk down Harmon to check this out! Thanks a million, and when I come back to Vegas you bet your ass I'll stop by!!!

Called and they said it was a great family location. When we arrived the guy told us they have no soda and no wifi. Cash only. Guy was creepy and obviously too lazy. He didnt want our business.  Place seemed scummy anyways.

Yup it was good pizza.  Had to try the Guinea Pie -- it was pretty good.  Service was really good.  Friendly as can be.  Clean, simple ambiance.  But damn was the kids' cheese da bomb.  Gotta give it a try.

My work usually orders from here and it's usually really good. I went here for lunch and my whole perspective changed. The inside is completely dirty, pizza boxes on the floor, smelled like they were smoking inside, someone came out of the bathroom and went straight to the kitchen before washing their hands, there are dirty paper towels with cups on them in the front mini fridge... I won't be back and that is too bad because it was good food. Yuck! Grossed out
One of my favorite pizza places in Las Vegas. My boyfriend and I like the Guinea pie and pizza blanco. Definitely try the poutine fries! They are awesome as well!

Wow this place sucks! Supposedly there are new people in the kitchen and they are IDIOTS.. Took almost 2 hours for a couple pizzas that were not even cooked when they arrived. Don't waste your time or appetite!!

I was craving some pizza and I've been wanting to check this place out for awhile.  I looked at the menu and was actually enticed by a few things like chicken wing dip and the pizza logs. I'm from Buffalo and just moved out here a couple years ago so I was excited I found a place that made those types of things. I ordered a delivery and saw the estimated wait time was 60-70min. I was like okay, no problem. At least it will be here by the time my other half leaves for work so he could take something with him.  Well, he couldn't even do that.  The delivery itself took over 2 hours which is ridiculous especially on a Monday. My delivery guy wasn't that friendly as well. No apology either.  I opened up my food and my chicken wing dip wasn't even close to being a dip. It literally was chicken fingers sticking on to burnt cheese and that's it. I couldn't even dip the bread in it. The pizza logs weren't logs either. They were just lumpy eggshells covered in grease with barely any filling in them. No pizza sauce with them either.  The only positive was my Philly eggrolls because I can at least see the filling on both side. I feel like I wasted 50 bucks and I couldn't even eat anything out of it.  I'm not impressed. I will not be ordering at the paradise location again.
Loved it.  The Philly rolls are bomb!!! The portions are huge.  The beer list is great.  Prices are way better than restaurants on the strip.

I had to call the restaurant from inside of it in order for somebody to come to the counter to take my order. Girl was short and unwelcoming to me. Sad because the pizza here is always very good. Too bad it's not good enough to make up for terrible service.

Awesome place! We ordered the suicide fries as the appetizer and it was amazing! It was spicy but the ranch helped balance it out. The seasonings were a bit heavy, it'd be perfect to munch on after a few drinks. 

As for their pizza, everything tasted sooo fresh. You can definitely tell that they make their food from scratch.

The pizza portions are huge by the way, so expect to take it home or share it. 
Other than that, will definitely come back to try more on the menu.

So we came here for pizza one afternoon for lunch we saw the shop on Guy Fieri show so we thought we would come in and try it the pizza was okay the restaurant and the service however it was terrible. Two waitresses there who were not all that interested in waiting on us and we're very slow with bringing water to our table or even checking to see if we wanted anything else to drink as well . as for the cleaning every single table in the restaurant was dirty and had leftover food on it from diners who had eaten and left so no I wasn't impressed with this place at all. I suggest you get servers who actually care about tending to the customers in actually keeping the place clean.
Pretty good pizza and garlic fries!  My only problem with the place is that there was no air conditioning....at least it was not on.   Still I would still recommend it!

I really enjoyed the pizza (again) but the service is always lacking (we've visited both locations once each).  I would rather order the pizza for pickup so I dont have to deal with the lack of service.

I had heard about this place for years but hadn't yet tried it. Tonight we went there with some friends and oh my gosh!!!!! It was to die for!!!!! We had the chop salad and a 1/4 Guinea pie. All three of us left stuffed and brought home leftovers. It was delish!!! Can't wait to go. Ack and try more!!!! Thanks for the great service and food.

If I could give a higher rating I would! AMAZING pizza! I got the 51 and it was so good! I can't wait to go back for more! It's close to UNLV so I will be going for lunch all the time. The prices are great as well, large portions for a great price. I highly recommend Naked City Pizza, you will be very pleased!

Our friends treated my wife and I here for our anniversary lunch and it was a super festive fourth of July!  Really, REALLY good pizza!!  I haven't had better in Las Vegas.  This is the real deal.  A small is plenty enough for two people.  Do yourself a favor and save room for some garlic knots, OMG!  Divine!  Two thumbs WAY up for this place!

This is suppose to be best pizza around it is not.  First time trying it paid $20.00 for half sheet got back and it was burnt.  Called no call back.  If you want good pizza go to Joes New York Pizza they are gourmet and much better even Dominos is better

I came and tried their Guinea pie pizza! It was delicious! A bit pricey but definitely worth trying! I don't regret it at all. The pizza crust was cooked to perfection and there was lots and LOTS of cheese! Small location so maybe not suitable for groups bigger than 6. This is definitely a more intimate place, inside is dim lighting, maybe because I came at night but overall was a great experience.

Naked City Pizza is aptly named because there is no cloaking the contempt my unfriendly server had for everyone in the place. The food is awesome! Served with an equal portion of bitchiness. Even asking a question about a menu item will probably get you a snide remark. As a former server, I can promise you you'll make more money in tips without being a snot to everyone who walks through the door. The food here is good and people will come! I'll be back, but next time, I'm getting my order to go. 

I would give this place a solid four stars on food, but you lose one thanks to employee offensiveness. 
Downtown New Yorkers might feel right at home with the attitude. Thanks to another review, we were prepared for "icy service," not an exaggeration in the slightest.
Sehr lecker, sowohl die pizza als auch die fries sind sehr zu empfehlen. Verwundert war ich über das ser sehr gute bier..... frisch gezapft

Saw it on food network and yes the pizza and meatballs are awesome and they were 5 min away from my hotel, very friendly staff recommended a few of the local favorites on the menu will be back for sure when I'm in Vegas again..

Roommate tried the 2 local pizza places by hyatt place and recommended here. I ordered the 1/4 sheet Rebel pizza, suicide fries and bag of zepolles. Quick friendly service and great tasting pizza. The zepolles tasted outstanding hot. The rebel pizza had awesome flavor and crust. The suicide fries lived up to the name. Hot hot hot and tasty. I'll be here again to try more flavours

The food is really good but there is no music and the girl who served us made us feel like we shouldn't be here. She was short and borderline rude. There was one other person here so I would think she would be happy to get another tip but it didn't seem
Like that. Cute young girl but not friendly at all. There are so many places to go so I'd suggest hiring friendly people or training them to be nice. I'm a local that loves the food but not sure this service deserves my business.

Just ate there (lunch) and the wings were good (had a good amount of meat on them) and the pizza was really good. Ended up getting two 1/4 sheets and between 3 of us guys there was plenty still left over for a 4th person after we were done. So yeah, watch it because they are more filling than you expect.

The one thing to note is that the wings arent super hot - we got medium to play it safe and would go a level hotter next time.

FINALLY when I ask for hot wings I got HOT wings and not what some places consider hot. Nothing like breaking a good sweat eating you wings. They were good. 
Guinea pie was also awesome and would totally get it again. Think I just found my new little spot to drop into when I am in town.
The food was great - we ordered WAY too much of it, but we couldn't resist the garlic knots or the fries with gravy.  The waitress was awesome.  If I lived in Vegas, I would definitely go back.

Best pizza by far in Vegas for the type of pizza you get.  What I mean by that is if you go to Settebello's in Green Valley, it is great but a different style.  The Guinea is the best white sauce pizza you will find anywhere.  The best red sauce pizza they have there is the fat boy.  The others are ok, but those 2 alone warrant a five star rating.  I got a special which was philly cheesesteak French fries and they were really dry and horrible.  But like I said, stick to the pizza and it is five stars.
I had a sales team to feed of 20 people!  Natasha made it happen and the 3 HUGE pizzas were hot and delicious!  My favorite pie in town!!!

So, yeah, it's a little divey, but I call that character. AMAZING pizza at a good price, great beer list, friendly people, just a little understaffed at times. If you're not offended by not having a Cracker-Barrel-esque waitress who calls you hon, you need to try this place.

Was very disappointed. Service was extremely bad. Waitress had taken our order and then almost 15 minutes later then proceeds to tell us that out order would take another 90 min??!! I had to go up myself to get utensils, extra plates. 

Soon after our order did come out. Pizza was delicious but would not come back again. 

Poutine was so salty. I'm originally from Quebec, Canada so we grew up eating some of the best poutine. Chicken wings were dry. And regular fries were just as salty.

Parking was also very bad. So limited in space.

The pizza is amazing!! I love their crust and the guinea pizza is the best. This will be my first time trying the  marinara sauce.

The location is convenient coming home from work. Staff is nice and courteous! 

You can walk rt next door grab a good cheap drink! 

But they do not like running your cc! 

I definitely would recommend this spot for some good food and drinks.

Naked City Pizza has been on our list when we head to Vegas, since we saw it on TV. Worth the wait and we WILL be back!
First off, the staff makes you feel like family. Our waitress was awesome, sassy and covered in Mickey Mouse tattoos. Just loved her!
We ordered the stuffed mushrooms and Back Home specialty pizza. 
The creamy sauce that came with the mushrooms was so heavenly, we were wiping our crust in it. The mushrooms were so good, we were sad when they were gone. The rectangular pizza had a light, garlicky crust and super fresh toppings. We ate it all, and it was huge!
I don't know what else to say...just go there!

Here's a shocker: The best pizza in Vegas is not on the Strip. Yes, I know you're gobsmacked, but it's true and Naked City Pizza is the proof. I usually don't pay that much attention to the Triple-D man, Guy Fieri, the man who single-handedly destroyed the Food Network, but occasionally some places he recommends are actually good. One was Broken Record back in San Francisco, but this may be his best find yet. This isn't the one he went to either as another Naked City Pizza, presumably the original location, is on the other side of the Strip in the back of a dive bar on Arville. Now that sounds like Triple D. Off the hook, dude.

This one is in a makeshift office building on the way to the airport which is exactly why Jamie W. and I ended up here. It wasn't crowded at about 5PM, just one ravenous family next to the window. The paper menu was a bit tattered, but we thought everything they offered appeared quite tempting. We decided the share the $7.50 Naked Salad, a bargain that combined iceberg lettuce, spinach, roasted sweet peppers, white onion, marinated tomato, and shredded mozzarella, all of it tossed in a housemade vinaigrette (photo: http://bit.ly/1RCNyjX). It was that tangy dressing along with the fresh ingredients that made this salad really hit the spot.

Because of the subheader description, "Featured on Food Network's DDD",  the Guinea Pie was our pizza of choice. It's made the old-fashioned Sicilian way in a rectangular, cookie-sheet shape with a soft, aerated dough that was quite amazing. The main topping was what they referred to as Grandma's Meatballs, which looked to be sliced and mixed with mint, accompanied by baby spinach leaves, heaping spoonfuls of ricotta, mozzarella and white garlic sauce. We decided to go for the $14.95 quarter sheet, which was plenty since it consisted of six hefty pieces (photo: http://bit.ly/1QoTOco). I think that dough could have handled any topping, but the white-on-white, Buffalo-style combination worked really well. OK, it was off the hook.

FOOD - 5 stars...genuinely exceptional pizza with a crust that really stands out
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...nothing special but certainly clean
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...initially a bit icy but warmed up as we shared our praise of the pizza
TOTAL - 5 stars...really unique pizza well worth getting out of the casino for

Some friends in town wanted some hot wings & I knew right where to go for them. They were definitely pleased with my choice. The pizza is some of the best in town. The peppers appetizers were SOOOO good. The fries are really good. I have also tried the open face steak sandwich and that is good also. Never had a bad meal there for sure.
Wow what a treat. The stuffed mushrooms are amazing. The pizza is great. The staff is friendly.

Met some friends for dinner on a Tuesday evening.  Naked City Pizza on Paradise was a great choice.  They have awesome pizza - if you like a medium thickness crust.  I got a 1/4 sheet Rebel pizza (like a meat lovers with pepperoni, hot Italian sausage, ham, salami, Roma tomatoes, basil, red sauce and mozzarella) and some Poutine fries (French fries covered in brown gravy and fresh mozzarella cheese).   More than I could eat - I have leftovers for tomorrow now!

They have salads, a variety of appetizers, wings and sandwiches/subs.  Definitely a place I will need to try several times.  I would definitely recommend this place!

OMFG!!!! Eat this pizza!!!! So freaking good!!!  

You know when you get full but can't stop eating because it's soooo good? Yeah that is this place!!! 

I walked over because of the yelp reviews. The outside is plain and boring. The inside has wall paper featuring unlv basketball and some buffalo bills stuff around. Sandy helped me. She is so nice and on top of everything. You can tell she's the HBIC! 

I ordered the guinea pie 1/4 sheet and loaded potatoe fries. The 1/4 is about the size of two personal pizzas. Sooooo goood!!! I'm not even a big fan of white pizza. I'm more of a plain cheese pizza kind of girl. It was so good!!! I'm still drooling over it. The loaded potato fries are soooo good. You can tell these are fresh home made fries. Not the frozen crap. Covered in cheese, sour cream, real bacon and chives.  The small was huge I don't know how big the large is.  

It's funny did take out. I'm sitting here eating this yummy food and crappy Pizza Hut is on tv lol. Eat naked ship the hut! Lol.
Still and always the best!!!!  Been to both locations in the last month!  Brought 7 people with me to Moondoggies that never had eaten at Naked City and they all loved it!!!!

Great place for lunch. I paid $2.50 for a slice of cheese and it came out hot, fresh and delicious. I really like the layout of the place too! It's clean and inviting.  I could enjoy my lunch and then relax for a bit. Oh, and they have green olives which is very hard to find in most pizza places. Love this place!

First time here. Ordered the guinea pie. Wish crust was crispy but still very good. For two people, I recommend you get 1/4 sheet. For leftovers, order 1/2+. Very laid back. Well worth it. Will order again. Maybe pineapple, jalapeño & white garlic sauce.
Delicious pizza!! Great service!!! Nice place to relax off the strip. Really enjoyed the food and staff! Stop by if you're in Vegas....you won't regret it!!

Great pizza and full menu of food items. From sandwiches to fries to wings, it's a bar food jackpot. Everything has something special about it, nothing is typical. The Office Bar where you eat and drink good microbrews is an awesome dive bar with friendly bartenders. They're always willing to help when it comes to tasting different beers.
