They also have cheap happy hour prices. It's 2 great places in one.

The food here is a 5. The service is a 3. There was one server and even though she was super nice she was struggling despite there only being 6 of us in the restaurant. They were out of draft beer and she didn't really know what they had in bottles. Cans of beer were delivered unopened with no offer of a glass. We had the poutine fries and a pizza. The fries were delicious and had the perfect amount of toppings, there was gravy in every bite. The 1/4 tray pizza had 6 huge slices. The crust was slightly thicker than I prefer but it was cooked perfect and had just the right amount of sauce. Oh, and the restaurant was so hot, it was borderline miserable.

Came here after a basketball game (with another one coming up), so the 14+ of us were already extremely hungry and on a time schedule. When ordering, we asked how big the salad proportion was, and the guy said "can serve 2-3 people," so my teammate and I decided to each get 1 slice of cheese pizza and share a Caesar salad. 

The slice of cheese pizza pleased me very much. It was a HUGE slice (looked like 2 but the other slice orders were just as big). It was delicious! The best part was that it was ONLY $2.75!

The Caesar salad does not feed "2-3 people." It's a good plate for just one person but probably still won't fill you up if you're hungry. Luckily, we ordered one too many salads, so my teammate and I ended up eating our own salad--best mistake we've ever made. The Caesar salad costed $8.50 ($11.50 with Chicken).

If you're ordering for only yourself, I recommend getting one slice and a salad. Perfect serving size for one!

The one con I'd add is the fact that the food took a really long time. We were in a bit of time crunch for our next game, so we were a little anxious for our food. Possibly, it may have also been because of our initial hunger and tiredness that made the 30minute wait drag on even longer. Plus, our group was big, so there's more understanding. However, I noticed on other reviews that their experience featured a long wait time as well...

Other than that, the place was great, especially for a large party. The others ordered a half sheet pizza, which filled them up. The waitress handled the multiple receipts perfectly, so you won't have to stress about dividing and managing money within the group if you do come in a big group!

Let me start by saying Facebook brought me here, and I am so excited I ordered the chop salad, and slice of the day both are incredible. 

The chop salad was Huge and the slice is beautiful. I am so thrilled they are soon to open in the old Blind Tiger location on Pecos. I will certainly be a return customer.

Went with a group of co workers while on business in Vegas. We spent most of our time at the Speedway and saw the billboards on the track and had to try it... it was awesome! Great flavors, great service!  Keep up the great work

Great pizza pie and beer selection. We came here on a lazy post trade show night.  Beer and pizza and chatting.  It's a perfect place to enjoy and hang out.  It's on the way to the airport and kind of divish from the outside.   My second trip here and I've tried 3 specialty pies - all have been great.  I think they cater as well.    It's theme seems to be casual NYC ...

My favorite pizza joint opened a location on the east side. Unlike its older sister, this one has its own location. You can still order from the office bar just like you do at moon doggie. I love Naked Pizza for their pizza, and this location did not disappoint me. Pizza is the best in town, my favorite over all. It takes awhile to get it, but it's worth the wait. Like I said about the moon doggie location. Very surprising how crispy the crust is even though the crust is thick. Sauce is spicy, cheese is very good, and the little pepperoni is perfect. Doesn't matter if its this place or the west location. I will continue to eat here every time we're in town.

I would love to give this place more stars but can't. The salad at $7.50 easily feeds two people and tastes awesome.
The pizza on the other hand had good flavor but it was so thick that it was virtually all crust over toppings. Because of that it tastes doughy. Concerning the toppings, they are really good but the amount was sadly super skimpy. Iv'e seen more toppings on a personal pizza than this one had and we ordered the 1/2 sheet.
The waitress was pretty dam efficient. Water was kept filled, came by frequently to see if we needed anything. Although I can see how she might be the one others have mentioned who has an attitude.
The place itself is pretty dam small and tight. Definitely not good for large groups.

I'm Buffalo born and raised, and Naked City does not disappoint.  The pizza and wings are really reminiscent of the pizza places I grew up with in the north town suburbs (Santoras, Picassos, Marvinos, Raymondos, etc).  "Buffalo style" pizza is unique and really hard to find outside of WNY.  I've lived all across the US and road tripped almost all 50 states and can't say that any other region has anything like it, but Naked City nails the crust, cheese and toppings (specifically, the little pepperoni that curl up when baked and act like delicious little oil cups).  I haven't tried much else beyond the pizza and mild/medium/hot wings & fingers (anything else isn't really a Buffalo Wing in my book), but I'll be back time and again just for that little taste of home.

Didn't really like the doughy pizza; it was kind of uncooked in the middle. Loaded fries were just okay, pretty greasy though and the fries were super dark like they were cooked in old oil. Stuffed mushrooms were pretty large but were stuffed with a large amount of sausage. All I tasted was sausage, should have been named sausage with mushrooms.

There are very few moments in life that are set in stone as "defining moments". Your first job, graduations, birth of a child and the very first moment you bite into the Guinea pizza. 

The exact moment that my taste buds experienced the sensation of flavors encompassed by a single bite, I knew I was experiencing something special. Take a slice, frame it and hang it in a museum. This has to be considered art. 

The venue is great and the staff was very welcoming. Our server was on point and I couldn't ask for a better experience. 10/5 would eat here again.

Guinea pizza was delicious as expected. The crust, the cheese, the shape of the pizza was everything that is pizza perfection. My only complaint is the giant pieces of sausage. If you love sausage then you will love this pizza. To me though I prefer my white pizzas vegetarian and the sausage was like 1" squares. Either way still probably the best pizza in Vegas. Glad I can move on from Metro Pizza now.

Pizza was really good! Super bummed they ran out of pepperoni! How does a pizza run out of that on a Tue!? Wings were delicious. It was empty when we went, but the server(guy) was pretty cool and took care of us. I think he was from Philadelphia. Him and I chopped it up about sports for a bit, haha. Dee will stop through next one in town. And oh yeah, the one on Arville is 21+ ONLY.

Went in on Saturday afternoon. The first thing out of the counter guys ( taller dark longer hair hipster type) mouth was " there's a reservation coming in and there will be no tables available. Also it's a 45 minute wait for takeout. " Uhhh "hello" would have been nice. He seemed like he was trying to convince my party of 5 to leave. Uhhh ok peace out and great customer service training. 

I started going to the other spot on Arville before the Guy Fieri episode circa 2010. Humbler beginnings then.  If you guys have too much business I will be sure to tell everyone to spend their money elsewhere.  So rude.

Great wings!  Some of the best you can get.  Also pizza was excellent as well. I will be back many more time when I'm visiting Vegas worth the trip to go here off the strip.  Place needs upgrading though.  Are server Sheila (I think that was here name) was super star waiter.  They don't come better than her!

Naked City Pizza on Paradise.. Sheesh.. Where do I start?! So I have been meaning to try this place out for quite sometime now and finally had the chance to do so when some friends came into town. Now this location is pretty much walking distance from the Hyatt Place hotel which was where my friends were staying. 

The night that we decided to give this place a shot there was pretty much no service whatsoever and what I mean by that is exactly what it sounds like.. No customer service... We called no lie about 4 times with no answer to the phone for a to-go order and finally maybe after the 5th attempt a woman answers the phone just to only place us BACK on hold.. If it wasn't for my friend being so adamant about wanting to have pizza from here I would've said screw it and went to one of the MANY pizza places in the area. The woman who came back on the phone was rather short and a bit rude because we had many questions about the menu. Oh and speaking of the menu the menu that they usually offer online wasn't able to be viewed because the website was down. SO yeah we of course would expect for some patience while we are trying to order food and give this business our money. 

One of the most rudest things a business can do is treat a potential customer with disrespect when trying to spend money at their establishment. Fast forward we ended up ordering the pizza, quoted the price as well as 30 minutes until the order would be ready. After arriving close to the time of what was told, while entering there was nobody at the front counter. A dim.. quiet place and after some minutes somebody finally came to the front who was the woman I assume was taking the orders. Told her my name and was then told the pizza still wasn't ready?.. How? It's a ghost town in here and furthermore you guys weren't doing anything but chatting back there..

Bottom Line.. Pizza was delicious but the customer service definitely left a bad taste in my mouth. Rule of thumb for me is I don't care how good the food is, if I'm not treated or welcomed warmly then I will never spend another DIME at your place of business. Period.

Ordered the Guinea's pizza as featured on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives. It was so delicious!!! Totally would recommend!  Ordered the Garden Salad as well and it too was yummy. 

Ordered the Meatball appetizer that they cook/serve in a skillet. We were disappointed by how little they gave us! The meatball app was served with a whole lot of cheese and some bread. Price was $11.95 for what was half a meatball just sliced  under the mounds of cheese! Our pizza which was about the same price had twice the meatballs than the meatball app dish. I called to ask if maybe they made a mistake. The girl who answered the phone said she would have the manager call me back but no one ever did. 

The food was a solid 4 stars but the service is what makes me rate it a 2!

This place makes the best pizza and wings I've ever had. I get the wings mild with a bleu cheese sauce and it is perfect. Not too much sauce and not too salty. The wings have a lot of meat on them, which makes it a really good buy. 

What really stands out is the pizza. This is premium pizza with generous toppings. I've had the slice of the day which you can't get on the menu. So far I've had taco, chicken finger, chicken parmesan, and a couple of others but they were all excellent. I love love love the slices of the day but I also like the traditionals like pepperoni and sausage. The slices are so big and filling. I had only one type I didn't like, and that's cause I don't like horseradish. I can't remember the name but it wasn't too bad. 

The customer service can improve a little, but rarely do I come to Vegas and get great customer service anywhere. They have two locations and this location is much more generous with the toppings so I only come here. 

I come here each time I'm in Vegas because I haven't found better wings and pizza! 

Tip: Get the Parmesan cheese with your pizza. It's good enough to eat on its own!

2 ... the guy was nice 



I had the Pizza in 2015... remembering it then being xtra cheesy and amazing. 




Stop by the other night (2017)  ..... it seemed like a cheap pizza .... would never go again. 

The pepperoni looked like hot dog chopped up 

It look like the pepperoni was added after the pizza was made. 

It didn't seem like it was right out the oven. 



Sorry guys,  not coming back ...


.... there's more competition on the corner at Harmon that's 24/7 fresh ...
Food is delicious, service is pleasant and the owner makes a hell of a pie.  Thanks for creating great pizza.
Taste better than chuck e cheese pizza!!! So yummy

Went for lunch, very disappointing. Service was perfect, friendly and helpful. everything else was downhill. The seating is the worst I've experienced in a long time - super low tables. Every time I moved my legs I thought I was going to tip the table. It is no place for a full sized man.  I ordered wings and I asked for them to be hot, a slice of pepperoni pizza and a small beef, cheese and peppers sandwich. The wings were perfectly cooked with good crispy exterior but very under seasoned and under sauced too. I asked for hot and they were the mildest wings I've ever had plus very little sauce was on them. I noticed that the plate they were served on only had a few specks of sauce left on it when I'd finished the wings. The pizza was not at all for my taste. The crust was very bready and doughy, soft and limp. The sauce had a very nice bright tomato flavor but no other flavor - no taste of spice, herbs etc., one dimensional and bland. the cheese was abundant but rubbery and the pepperoni was warmed thru w/o any bit of char. It tasted like it needed more time in an oven or like it was microwaved. It was boring and bland. The sandwich came wrapped in paper which seemed weird for an order that wasn't to go.I had the sandwich last and I think the paper wrapping made the bun steam a bit. By the time I ate it, the bun was soft on the outside where it should have had some crusty texture. Was not appealing. The meat was grey, dry, featureless, unseasoned and the little bit of cheese seemed like an afterthought.  The sandwich as a whole tasted of peppers and little else, like the other two items, totally bland and boring. . I tried three items and all three were bland, boring, poorly executed. Think hospital food.  Also, very uncomfortable seating. Wont return.

This was some of the best pizza and I'll probably be back for the pizza. However the waitress was not friendly at all, some of the worst service I've ever experienced. every time we asked for something she would look at us and give us a negative vibe. She even forgot to put in our pizza order and after asking her about it she lied and told us that the pizza had burnt so they had to make a new one took 45 minutes to get a 6 slice pizza . I'll be back but hope she's not there did not feel comfortable eating with her around. I'll probably take it home and serve myself.

Came here with a group of friends last night. All of us but 1 have never been here so we were all excited to try out this place our friend was raving about. Parking is scarce, so it was a good thing most of us carpooled. The restaurant isn't really big, but was big enough to have 2 parties of 10 and a couple of extra tables for other guests. 

Being a fan of the Food Network shows, I was pleased to find that Dining, Drive-Ins & Dives was here....so naturally, I ordered what Guy ordered. 

Suicide Fries:  Fries smothered in a hot pepper blend and habanero-garlic sauce. Topped with sliced jalapenos and yellow peppercinni. 
   I wasn't too thrilled with it because the fries were wet and soggy. I have to note that the sauce they used was the same sauce they used on their 'suicide' hot wings. The sauce had a nice heat and kick to it, with a nice, smoky flavor.

Guinea Pie Pizza: Grandma's meatballs, spinach, ricotta, white garlic sauce and mozzarella.
   I ordered the smallest one they had, the 1/4 sheet. Man! It's HUGE! I swear it can feed a whole family! I had about one slice which was really good. The dough is homemade and I was told that the chef grows his own herbs, which is a big plus! 

Why 3 Stars? 
1. The fries were soggy. Not because it was smothered in the sauce, but because the fries wasn't crunchy to start with.
2. The wait for a table. It was a long ass wait.
3. The restaurant was dimly lighted. The guy standing in the front, behind the register, didn't even have lights to see. It wasn't until we were about to leave(11:30pm) that someone figured out that they should turn on some lights for the restaurant!

i saw the joint on Triple D a few years ago and decided to try it the next time i was in Vegas.  This weekend i was in Vegas and looked up the details.  I happen to see some negative reviews about the place so i called and spoke to the chef.  Satisfied that it was not terminal, i went to Paradise store with a buddy and ordered the Suicide Fries (OMG hot), two specialty pizzas and the Ma Burger.  Fries were too spicy for me to eat but tasty. The two specialty pizzas (chitown and the one featured on DDD, they were very very good.  The MA burger was insane and recommend it.  Give the place a try and ignore the negative postings.

I was hoping for a slice of New York style coming here, but was actually surprisingly pleased by the corner thick piece of pizza I received upon ordering.  I went with a piece of their daily special, a meat-lover's, and a create-your-own with some peppers and mushroom.  The middle of the pizza was average.  It had a nice kick to it, especially once lathering it with pepper.  But overall just a typical slice.  The crust was very good though and I could just eat that for days.  At less than $5 for a full on specialty and less than $ for a basic cheese, this place is a steal.  The slices are huge and preparation time is reasonable.  Couple that with some ncie beers on tap and a $9 pizza and beer deal to boot, and now we're talking.  Glad they opened another location on the west side.

Got a slice of pizza it was Square Aldo sauce is not evil e put on the pizza hold the cheese off with face and sticking to the dough so I'm at the pizza sauce was looking at Ladle evenly on the pie Adam add pepperoni they gave me little Mini-Me pepperonis M&M size are you kidding I've never gotten those little itty bitty ones on a pizza I would have been embarrassed to serve that pizza
This pizza and wings make me feel like I'm transported back to western New York. So damn delicious

Got a bunch of stuff.   The guina pizza was awesome.   I'll give it a 4 based on pizza.  Zero on everything else.  Everything else not so much: salad was soggy and tasteless, chicken parm hero was burnt with barely any sauce on mediocre bread, spicy fries were fair.  Really spicy though.    Next time I'll just get pizza and it will be 5 stars.

Two stars only because the staff is always nice, NOT for the pizza.  I called Wednesday to see IF they would take an order on Thursday for a pick-up on Friday at 11:00am the same time they actually open their doors.  I called Thursday and the staff was very accommodating for a pick up  at 11:00 the next day.  Last day of work/school for CCSD teachers and I had 17 teachers at my house for PIZZA lunch.  I don't live close to this location, but I wanted to pay GOOD money for GOOD pizza.

That was not the case.  3 FULL sheet pizzas for a total of $84 including tax and the Pizza was pathetic.  Dry, overcooked, minimal cheese!  The flavor of the pizza sauce was the only saving grace AND 17 very hungry teachers that had been at school since 7:00am and arrived at my home at 11:30am, they were starving and they just started eating.  ALL of my guests felt the same as they chowed down and critiqued the unsatisfying treat.

Maybe I called too early and they cooked it way to early for my 11:00am pick up, I'll never know.

Thanks Naked City Pizza for the embarrassing portrayal of GOOD Italian pie.!

I am not sure where to start. We started off by ordering beer. Their selection is horrible. Really?? Molson is like your profiled beer? We then ordered some garlic knots. 20 min later they came out in a pool of flavorless marinara sauce. The dough was also flavorless. We then ordered 2 of the smaller pizzas, the Guinea Pie and my friends ordered some arugula pizza with an egg on it. When the waitress brought the arugula/egg pizza out, she started smearing the egg all over it with a fork....and she kept smearing.....and smearing....it was so unappetizing. I took a bite and I'm not even kidding...I thought I was going to gag. It was salty...and tasted like a stink bomb. If you want good pizza, go to Metro or Grimaldis. Hell...I think Dominoes would have been better and that pizza is terrible. My friend decided to take the left overs...I made him put the box in the trunk of my car. When I dropped him off I opened the trunk and I swear I thought Tony Soprano hid a body in there. Ack. Oh! I forgot to add that the waitress brought us the pizza that belonged to the people next to us. When she realized it, my husband was already dishing up a slice and she ran to him, slapped his hand off of it, took it back, and served it to it's rightful owners!! You can't make this up.

I've lived in Vegas for a little over a year now, and up until this point, was disappointed with all of the pizza places I've been to. For the most part, the local places all serve pizza with really thin crust, but I like a med or thick crust pizza. Naked City Pizza is the first place I've been to that had a really good medium thickness crust, and the sauce is great as well. I usually just get plain cheese, and I get the "Not so wee" size, which is pretty big and goes for $13.00. I've also tried their pizza that had veggies and white sauce, it was pretty good, but I'm not a huge fan of white sauce. I've also tried their suicide fries a couple times. I'm a fan of freakishly spicy food, I think they taste great, and I give it around a 7 on the heat scale. The staff is also very friendly, and the service is prompt. I live walking distance, so I usually call ahead of time, and my order is ready within 10 minutes of me placing it. Naked City Pizza is highly recommended and by far my favorite pizza in Las Vegas.

Great pizza for amazing prices. I occasionally order pizza without cheese since i am lactose intolerant and Naked pizza accommodated me and made me a pizza with no cheese even though i only ordered a slice. In addition to the slice of pizza i ordered i also ordered the Poutine Fries which i highly recommended to anyone eating here. 

Another thing that has really impressed me multiple times is the customer service. I've eaten here and had the pleasure of having multiple different servers and all have been attentive and extremely pleasurable. They make you feel like you're a friend.

I've been back to have Pizza again and it was just as amazing as all the other times. This time  there was 8 of us and everybody enjoyed it. We tried everything from Appetizers to Pizza to Wings which the wings were great especially the Italian style. Been craving it so going this weekend, Halloween weekend can't wait...

Great late night spot for one of the best and most unique pies in Las Vegas. This is a dive bar without the booze - soft drinks only. But you feel like you are back in Buffalo hanging at the local spot. 

The Guinea pie is just perfect - Grandma's meatballs with spinach and ricotta - this is the bomb. The Rebel is also excellent.

ONLY reason i'm giving 4 stars is because dinning room could be a bit cleaner. With that said....You don't go to this place for the low lit dinning room. Food this good you don't need light to eat! Pizza was so good we ate there 3x on a 5 day Vegas trip (once nor twice was just not enough!). Now it's a MUST GO when ever in Vegas! 
Pizza was PERFECT, great sauce, crispy edge crust and plenty of toppings! NOTE: If traveling with kids don't visit the location on S. Arville St!

The food here is amazing! It's always a debate between this location and the original, because the food is great at both, but the other one is inside a bar. If you want no cigarettes, quiet relaxed restaurant, come to this location. If you want a good place to watch a game, with a full bar, etc then go to the other location.

No matter which location you choose, the food will be delicious! I know their highlight is the pizza, but don't be afraid to try out some of the daily specials too. Chris is an actual chef, not just a pizza cook. He always has interesting items that include things like homemade pasta, truffles etc. Go for it!

Waited over an hour and never got our pizza. Waitress did not even re-fill our drinks. At the time we placed our order there was only one person ahead of us. I have never walked out of a restaurant or given a place a bad review. This was an exceptionally bad experience. Don't even bother with this place.
Came here from reviews from Yelp.. Yes it was so good I didn't wanna share lol I really came in for a slice and ended up with more lol

Completely on point pizza similar to New York sicilian style. The flavor combinations are amazing. The helping of the meatballs on the Guinea pie is awesome. The location is good because it offers more room for families and isn't in a bar, like its original location. Bottom line: highly recommended!

I love pizza! I'm also kind of a pizza snob. No chain pizza for me. I like the hole in wall family owned places, because those are the best!

We went on a Thursday night. It is located right behind the strip near the hard rock. 
Naked city's location is hard to find and kind of looks like office buildings but once you find it, it's not hard to miss.

We walked in and the staff seemed very friendly. The manager ( from the Arville location) was our server. She was friendly, and very helpful ordering.

We ordered a Wee sized Cheese pizza with Basil. It was amazing Super fresh, you can tell everything is made to order.
We also order poutine fries, these were yummy as well. The fries were hand cut, not the frozen freezer kind.

I definitely suggest this place. Will definitely visit again!!
Always heard great things about this place and I was dying to try it. It didn't disappoint and I'll be coming back with the family asap!

This was a great pizza, period. Had the back home and it was simple and that's just what it needed to be. The crust was a perfect thickness but still crispy. Here is my my only complaint. The signage SUCKS!!! Being a tourist makes it nearly impossible to see unless you drive around a bit.

Omg, we came here in pursuit of one of Guy Fieri's picks on DDD. The salad, meatball skillet appetizer and the 2 pizzas we had were OFF THE CHARTS amazing!!!!!!!! Summer our waitress was very nice, and they have beer and wine to boot! 5 stars!!

Tonight was the Best Service Ever !!!! Sandy Was Our Waitress and she was absolutely amazing !!!! It was super busy and she was the only one waiting on tables ,  & cashing out !!! She had a smile on her face the whole time and was super friendly !!!! She didn't have anyone waiting long for there food either.....that's how impressed everyone was !!! The food was also amazing !!! We moved here from Buffalo N.Y. A year ago and the Pizza & Wings made it seem like we were back in Buffalo !!!! What an awesome evening and dinner !!!! Thanks To Sandy

I discovered naked city a few months ago and have been eating it at least 3x a month now. I always order the guinea pie. I have yet to receive a bad pie but it was bound to happen and it did last night. I can never remember what they call they're sizes so I've always asked for the middle size and it's never been an issue. Got to the store and received the small size 6 pieces. They were about to close and I was charged for the small as well so I didn't make a fuss. Once me and my family started eating we both noticed our fist pieces didn't have any meat. So we kept eating and more than half of the pizza was like that. Usually you can see whole circle pieces of sausage throughout the pizza but this looked as if there was maybe 3 pieces of meat crumbled across the pizza we were lifting the cheese hoping it was under there too it wasn't. I kid you not it was so bad I literally saved any meat I came across from my pizza and added it to my sons slices. Really disappointed... these are the cheapest pizzas. Still give 3 stars because I love the Arville location and this is the only issue I've had with naked city and I'm not sure if the small order is different than the larger ones as far as meat quantity. Will still be a loyal customer

Our first visit was, unfortunately, terrible. They had a bunch of people call out sick and we ended up waiting over an hour with no food. Luckily, their owner contacted me after seeing a negative review and went out of his way to make things right. Now that I've tried the food, I'm thoroughly impressed. The crust was probably my favorite in town and the only thing keeping it from 5-stars is my personal preference for a bit more sauce on my pie ... it was just a bit dry for me.
Everything we tried was super delish!  My husband loves spicy but the suicide fries were more than he could handle!

Not really a big fan of waiting 45 minutes for a small pizza, unless it's being delivered. The crust was solid oily crust and actually burnt black on the bottom. WAY overrated. Sorry Guy, I don't agree that this place is any good.

Went here on a spur of the moment decision and I'm glad I did. I should say first that I'm a thin, hand tossed pizza crust kind of guy. This was a little thicker than that and not something I would typically have ordered, but they make it work, mostly because of the quality ingredients, from the tangy sauce to the cheese to the toppings.
Few things: 
The half sheet is a huge square cut monster that'll feed a large family
The wings are awesome, enough by themselves to bring me back. 

I will definitely come back to try their sandwiches, especially the East coast standard beef on weck

my borther an i had a bro trip out to vegas and this is one of the many spots we hit up. The food was awesome i really enjoyed it and we where able to try a couple different items on the menu. we tried there stuffed mushrooms and they where good. we also tried thered stuffed banana peppers and i really enjoyed those too there items are really cheesy which is always a plus for me. we tried a couple of there sliced pizzas and i really liked the ratios of everything on it the crust was on point, the sauce was good and the cheese was nice and cheesy :) last we tried there beef sandwich and there garlic fries this was probably my least favorite of all the items we tried but all in all it was a 5 star experience an i will be coming back when im in town

Could have made the same quality of pizza at home. 
The waitress was the only redeeming quality. She was working hard!

I would be CAREFUL of the food purchase here, it may ruin you're whole night, now after reading some other bad reviews I understand why. In Vegas for a friends Bday, she wanted wings I wanted pizza and this was down the street and looked decent, so we ordered take out for lunch.

Well the pizza tasted good and the wings were just alright nothing to rave over

Now I'm guessing the wings were just alright, reason being most likely undercooked. Resulting in both me and my friend having food poisoning within hours of eating the only thing we ate that day. 

Hours later both shitting our guts out, super nauseous and then later in the night puking up everything left in our stomachs, couldn't eat for the rest of the day

Wouldn't think so much if it just happened to one of us but to two people at the same exact time? Idk 

Well thanks Naked Pizza on paradise

Friendly service. Pizza was doughy, very little sauce, ordered the Naked City Pizza and the veggies were sparse. Disappointed overall and while it's convenient, the overall experience was a bummer. Surprised the feedback has been positive from friends, maybe after a night of drinking it's an alternative to more expensive casino food.
Outstanding. I gave the staff a standing ovation when they brought the bill. Incredible pizza and wings. Possibly the best server I've ever encountered. Absolutely is staple in my diet now.

Being that I'm from NJ and when I say this is some really tasty pizza you can bet your you know where it is! Vegas hard to find pizza that's tasty well this place has it and I can't Waite to try some other items on the menu... Try it use Uber Eats and place your order because it's really some great Pizza closest to NY/NJ taste quality I have found...

I dare say the food at this location is better than at moondoggies. Boyfriend and I had wee guinea pizza, poutine, and wings after a 7 mile bike ride. Everything was fantastic and the server gal was pleasant. I was bummed about the beer selection (i had two in mind from their list but both were out) but had a Canadian beer that the gal recommended in lieu and I was pleasantly surprised. 
-1 star for draft beer being something in the range of 7$ a piece!!!
Amazing pizza and wings. Staff was also great. This location is more chill & faster than the location on Arville. Needs a bigger sign though because everyone needs to know about this place.

WOW! Pleasantly surprised! Had to be one of THE BEST pizzas I ever had- if not THE best!! So good!! 

I started with the Naked City salad which was a good portion and had the right amount of dressing- usually salads are drenched! 

For dinner I had a wee Guinea pizza which included meatball, spinach and garlic. Man, oh man! Solo delicious! A wee is big enough to take three slices home! 

Finished it with Zeppolones, a fried dough dessert. Also screaming but way too many are included. 

I gave it 4 stars because they didn't have the football game on because they don't have cable. Really?! Missed the whole first half! 

This will be a regular visit for me while in town for business, regardless of my diet!!

There's nothing really that bad I can say about Naked City Pizza. There are only a few times where they either had to make an ingredient for a certain dish or either warm up the oven for pizza but I wouldn't give that much blame because I show up usually right when I get on lunch from work which is the time they open, 11am. But other than that great food, and the lady is always nice and treats customers very professionally and courteous. 

Make sure to call up or look at their social network accounts to find their later-in-the-day specials that don't make it to their regular menus. Really affordable for the items they offer.

My boyfriend hails from Buffalo/Niagara Falls, NY, so we are always on the lookout for places in Vegas with pizza that reminds him of home.  We came upon Naked City, the Paradise location on Yelp.  Here is our interesting experience...

It was a bit hidden as other Yelpers pointed out, but we found it and parked in the dimly lit parking lot surrounded by dive bars.  My son, bf, and I went in and were promptly greeted by a friendly hostess.  The restaurant is on the smaller side, but not cramped at all.  Freshly painted and I loved their wooden tables, although my bf is over 6' tall so he felt the table a little low for his knees.  Great music selection playing, mix of oldies and classic rock and black and white photos adorning the walls. 

The server was warm and funny, we liked her right away. We ordered the poutine, the buffalo wings, and a half sheet of pizza, half with pepperoni, half cheese.  My man was glad to see they had Gennessee ale.  Poutine was delicious. Crispy fries, warm salty gravy, chunks of melty cheese, what's not to love?  My bf didn't, but he doesn't know what he's talking about.  Buffalo wings....wiiiiinnnngggss. Yum.  Perfect crisp combination of meaty wing and medium sauce that was enough to make me die happy.

 Now... here's where the story goes a lil south.  An obviously very drunk, loud man entered and sat down yup, right next to us. He loudly states to no one that he's waiting for a pizza to go with "meat...all the meat!" He looks over at us and says hi to my bf who gamely engages in small talk with him, during which he asks for one of our wings.  My bf politely declines. 

Now time seemed to stretch on into infinity with us waiting for our pizza and Drunkie Drunkface waiting for his.  In this time he continued to slur to my very hard of hearing son, learned some sign language, and insulted where I'm from.  Our pizza came first, and was fantastic.  Crust was thick as I read in other reviews, but a pizza with that much stretchy, flavorful cheese requires a sturdy, fluffy crust that can stand up to it and show it who's boss.  The sauce was good, and in perfect proportion to the cheese and crust.  Drunkie is staring slack jawed and unabashed at our pizza like he was gonna wrestle it from our hands.  I tell my bf to let him have a wing. He was so happy, munching away.  Once we were full (which was quick since we basically inhaled the pizza) we gave Drunkie the rest of our wings, and waited for the server to come with the bill. She didn't come. And I was so ready to be done. 

TBH, I felt like she was avoiding eye contact with us, knowing this guy was there and she didn't want to deal with confrontation.  Okay, I don't blame her... a lot. So we said our goodbyes and carried our remaining pizza up to the counter for a box and to pay.  I informed the server we had entertained Drunkie for our entire meal and asked if there could be a discount involved and she said, "I know. I'm so sorry." And discounted us 10% (which we incorporated in her tip anyway).  It was VERY nice of her to do that, but I would've rather enjoyed my delectable meal in mozzarella filled peace.  And that my friends, is the only reason for the 4 instead of 5 stars.  I would definitely do it again, maybe to-go next time, but believe me that food is worth it all!

7 adults and 3 kids gathered here recently and we shared a number of dishes.  Once again, Naked City gave us great food from starter Happy Plate to cannoli dessert.

We started with the Happy Plate which was a combination of vegetables, two cheeses, and olives served with some crostini.  Then came the pizza doughnuts which are not on the menu yet.  It's a combination of two cheeses and some pepperoni wrapped in a dough and deep fried and served with marinara.  You could pig out just on these.

Then came three Naked City subs--a pizza sub, a Matty P sub (a more traditional salami, ham, cheese sub), and a ham slaw sub which was the winner hands down.  The ham salad in the sub was wonderful.  This was a winner with the whole group.  We also got a bowl of hand cut fries with the sandwiches.

Next came the pastas.  There was penne a la vodka (the favorite by far), a creamy mushroom Alfredo, cappellini served with Naked City marinara, and the last was Naked City Sunday gravy served with house marinara stewed with beef and sausage.  To accompany the pastas, there were two large chicken parmesan breasts.

To cap off the experience and for the kids of all ages, we got the Buffalo pizza 22 with white garlic sauce, sausage, pepperoni, crispy garlic, hot honey, and mozzarella.  This pizza divided the group. I was taken aback when I got to the hot honey on the pizza.  It was supposed to be hot from red pepper flakes but I tasted sweet honey and although I liked the pizza, this flavor doesn't say pizza to me. I guess I'm too set in my ways.

If this weren't enough, we got a plate of cannoli for dessert.

Service was great and we left stuffed from a lot of good Italian food.  Naked City doesn't disappoint!

First time coming here. I've been to Vegas quiet a bit of times and never heard of it until today. The place is a little hole in the wall but food is amazing ! I got the loaded bake potato fries, they were pretty good! Then we order the "freakin huge" guinea pie pizza.... Let me just say it was one of the most delicious pizzas I've ever had! I will def come back when I visit ! Don't know what the other negative reviews were about but we had good service and it was clean inside too.

They have just about all the ingredients to be a success. Menu is great, they promote local breweries and the staff is friendly. The location is a little questionable. I am rooting that they can overcome that problem. It is clear that they use top quality ingredients in their pizza. Cheese that is soft and gooey, tomato sauce that your grandmother would envy and sausage that is superior to any chain store. I would also recommend the Hamslaw sandwich. A good old fashioned hero that you wont find anywhere else. My only complaint was that the dishes do not come out together. The server brings them out one at a time and it is awkward to have entrees for half the party and wait for the rest. (I have seen this complaint on another review)
That should be easily corrected.

Not overly impressed with the lunch slice but the price is great for what you get.  Havent got a chance to try some of the other things will give these guys another shot as I have a TI right around the corner for the next month.
Fantastic pizza, and excellent service from a small and intimate restaurant.  The "Guinea Pie", is legendary.  Amazing place and I will be coming back.  Great place!

A really good place. Portions are huge. Owner is a nice guy and waitress is very knowledge about each item on the menu. This location does not have as much variety as the original (so we were told) but still a lot to choose from. A nice break from all the places on the strip. Thanks Triple D!

Cool location near Thomas & Mack.
The pizza is good, and has lots of topping options. I really liked the dough-y crust, but my husband wasn't a fan. Depends on your preference.
Props for offering local (local Vegas and local Buffalo) beers, but with such a small selection, I couldn't really find one I liked.
Prices are good and they have really great specials during NFL games.
The tables are low and the chairs are high. So much so that you can't fit your legs underneath. Annoying. On this same note, the decor inside is really simple (no problem there), but it also borders on uncomfortable. Add that to the fact that there's only 2 tvs, and you're not exactly gonna go here to hang out and watch football.

I have never had such horrible service in my life.  Walked in, was seated right away... Only 5 tables in the restaurant occupied.  So we sit... and we sit, and we sit.  Walk to the cash register twice inquiring about our pizza and was told "when you walked on, it was a 45 minute wait, now it's an hour and a half." I have a great idea, how about telling people when they walk in there is a ridiculous wait for pizza, we would have walked out.  When it takes and hour and a half to bake a pizza when you have 5 tables... There is serious mismanagement.  Waitress apologizes sarcastically while making every excuse in the book why no pizza.  Go to one of the other locations and save yourself a hassle.

Have heard great things about this place. Don't believe the hype. Was not impressed. Pizza was just ok. Would've given it 3 stars but the service was very sloooooooow. The only positives are the portions are big and price is good.
Best in Vegas !!!!! We order almost everyday and everybody is super cool there the pizza is super tasty !

We were on Spring Break and my daughter calls from New Mexico asking us to try a place called Naked City Pizza that she just saw on Food Network Channel. So we thought we give it a try and boy we were in for a surprise. We had Poutine which we never had before and all I have to say is it's was to die for. We also ordered a full sheet of half pepperoni and cheese pizza that also was some good a$$ pizza. We also tried the Guinea Pie that was off the hook. This was the best tasting pizza we had in Las Vegas. I had to order some to fly back to NM to have my family try. They all agreed it was some kick a$$ pizza hot or cold. I plan on visiting again and will recommend this pizza place to friends and family who plan on visiting the 702!! Guy Fierro wasn't joking!!!

Visiting from Los Angeles, had to try another Diners, Drive-ins & Dives restaurants....this is not the location they filmed at, very close to strip...we were not disappointed!! Great pizza! The crust is amazing! Very thick and filling.  Fries are awesome! My son wanted to order some to go. LOL My other son had the chicken parm sandwich and loved it! Wanted to tell the owners how much he loved it! He just happened to be there watching the Buffalo Bills game...it's a Bills Bar! We went here on our 1st day of our trip and we will be back before we leave! Thanks for the awesome food and service!!

Service lacked a bit on my visit there but the food was what I came for. I usally go to the other location but today I needed something a little more quite and low key. Had the suicide fries and the Sal if I am correct. They Italian sausage sandwich. I got some marinara to dip the sandwich in and everything was really good. Glad I found this second location of Naked City Pizza. Even though I am not a fan of the pizza I have a few favs that make me stop in.

Second time eating at naked city but first time at this location

Food consistent at both location in Vegas and the service was awesome

Ian from CA. And make it here every time we are out to Vegas

Can't wait to come back and try another pizza

The suicide aside is super hot made my scalp sweat and I am a spicy eater be careful

Thank you naked city pizza

I am currently eating dinner, or attempting to eat dinner, with my family and this is by far the worst experience ever.  This is not my first time eating here and normally I am not only satisfied but eager to return. 
The restaurant was empty and the waitress commented that it is a bit slow and has been this way all day ( it is 6:30pm). 
And here we go.....
There are no lemons for the water( they ran out)
Our loaded fries were served cold and the cheese not melted. Our group of 6 all eat a forkful or two and brought it to our waitress' attention and then we were told that the chef would make us another order but would have to charge us for a small because we ate some. Really?!?
We ordered 2 chopped salads and they ran out of spinach ....hmmmmm so this non-busy restaurant is  not prepared for service and is not willing to serve quality food to their paying guests. 
I guess I will have to find another pizza establishment to patronize.
Get it together....

Went last night, about 9:30PM.  There were 3 tables occupied, and when we walked in the only server greeted us and told us it would be a few minutes because all the empty tables were dirty.  OK, we waited about 7 minutes.  While we were waiting another table that was occupied placed their order.  Finally we were seated and the server comes over with a rag to wipe down the table she seated us at.  I can tell you this place is definitely a dive.  Floors were dirty, along with the tables.  We finally ordered a half sheet (12 slices) of the Guinea pie.  1/2 hour later our pizza arrived and it was very delicious.  I'll take off a bit because the meatballs on the pizza were dry and lacked flavor, but overall, pizza was great.  While we were eating we noticed this man, who definitely looked like a homeless person come in and start sweeping the floors.  I thought perhaps the employee gave him a few bucks to help her out.  When we left there was another homeless person outside with a shopping cart, apparently just waiting for ???perhaps the guy inside.  Maybe next time we can try the Arville location.

Came for lunch early on Sunday morning and it didn't even look like it was open.  Had to check the door to even see because no other customers were around yet.  Glad we made sure though! We walked in and we we're warmly greeted right away.  We had are choice of anywhere we wanted to sit so we took a table in the middle of the room.  The only reason I'm giving them a 4 is because the tables were kinda uncomfortable other wise it's 5 all the way. We were with another couple and we both wanted different pizza toppings so they got a 1/4 sheet of the Rebel which had pepperoni, sausage, ham, salami, tomato and fresh basil while we had a 1/4 sheet of the chitown which was chunks of Italian beef, giardinare and roasted peppers, olive oil and oregano. We also got an order of wings with the Sicilian hot sauce on half and the put bbq on the other half.  We started it all off with the garlic cheese rolls. Think cinnamon roll only pimped out pizza style.  These were awesome and I'd recommend them to anybody.  The pizza is more of a neoploitan style with a thicker crust and made and served on a cookie sheet and cut in big squares.  They had a nice amount of toppings and cheese along with a tasty sauce and an excellent crust. The wings were cooked to perfection and served with a fair amount of celery and carrot sticks all with a really good quality blue cheese and/or Ranch dressing. Both styles were great but I thought the BBQ was outstanding. We quickly realized we could have easily gotten away with ordering 1 pizza and 1/2 the wings and had more then enough food. Our server was super cute and friendly and gave us great service so it made our visit even better.  All and all this was a great lunch selection and we were very happy.  I'm a big fan of getting off the strip and eating locally where the prices are better and the people are real.
This pizza is different in a good way. Very cheesy with a buttery (thick) crust. Great personable service. I will return.

Been here now 4 times. First 2 times great food and customer service. The last two times in the past month have been not soo good experiences. Wings dry  and overdone, sloppy salad & over done garlic buns. Staff not that friendly either. I understand bad customer service when it's busy, but not when only one table has customers.

Pizza= cold with an abundance of cold cheese and lackluster dough. A simple cheese slice with sweet peppers should have tasted better and at least been hot (in temp.). It was not. 3 slices and a starter of stuffed banana peppers came out in reverse order; slices  first?? Not only did this occur in weird fashion, but the slices were clearly made before the starter was finished so they just brought them out to prevent them getting cold....well that was a fail because I bit into huge clumps of cold cheese and lukewarm sauce on dough that had little taste. I believe the slice wasn't even cooked long enough because it lacked the browning bubbles that cheese gets when browned. 

When the starter finally arrived, it was stuffed Anaheim chiles and NOT yellow banana or Hungarian peppers. A big let down when the menu states what they were supposed to be and the two peppers are very different in taste. Moreover, it was clear that the peppers were charred quickly then stuffed, and not baked with the stuffing leaving the peppers still crisp/raw and not cooked enough. This was also a lukewarm item placed atop a bed of COLD ranch dressing? Supposedly white garlic sauce but definitely was ranch dressing. Gross. And two peppers for $9.50 is not pizza joint price.

Overall, the food was less than mediocre and the service was slow for being the ONLY diners. 

Won't return

Omg!wish I could give negative stars! Literally everyone who was in that restaurant just now looked just as pissed as me.thE food took FOREVER!!! From what my family got I mean...it was decent. ..just cuz I was starving....but I ordered a burger...I wish I could have an opinion about it but I never got it!!! The girl completely forgot and just said ohh sorry I thought I forgot something. they did nothing to.fix it! The food was fine but I would never come back due to the lack of attentiveness, horrific service and not to mention when I asked about the menu she had no clue..I'm done

My fiancé, her, kid, her mom and I went for the first time to this place to celebrate her moms birthday. The waiting was almost two hours. The waiter didn't have good customer service skills. The food was average and the price was a little above average. By the time we got our food we were all frustrated, starving, and disappointed. Overall this place is way overrated, and I don't recommend it at all under any circumstances.
Excellent food. Great staff. Take home left overs to eat tomorrow. Pizza , garlic fries and wings are all terrific.

Great pizza  and off the strip location ...
The pizza was really good  crusty and cheesy and cooked perfectly.  
Dad and I both liked it...
The guy who works there is very interesting and has a masters in science.  Impressive!
The venue is super old and dinky. We just got off our flight and the restaurant is closing soon. So we received almost no service.

I just happened to be in Vegas and caught an episode of Triple D when this place was featured showing the making of the Guinea Pie. It looked so good, homemade meatballs,  spinach,  mozzarella and ricotta cheese with garlic sauce. We decided to check it out and I am so glad that we did. It was amazing! We ordered the 1/2 sheet and split a chopped salad between 3 people.  We had plenty of left overs which we brought home to California. The service was great. Our server Gregory was very nice, attentive and personable. I would highly recommend checking this place out.

We tried the famous Guinea pie, 2 regular slices, the meatball appetizer and wings. Overall we sort of enjoyed our meal but the meatballs were not my favorite at all. The meatballs were too thick sliced and really dense for the Guinea Pie which made it odd to eat. When biting into the pie everything was soft and easy to bite into except when biting into a meatball. It was dense and hard and ruined the pie for me, I pulled most of the meatball off or avoided biting into it. Fiancé said the same about his meatball appetizer. 

Wings at most establishments disappoint me as we are very particular about very crispy well done wings, light on the sauce.  Even though we stressed light on the sauce they still were coated generously which resulted in flaccid skin wings. We noticed the table next to us ordering plain wings and they looked pretty crispy and regretted that maybe we just should've got them plain. 

Would I come back to Naked City Pizza? Yes I would, I crave Sicilian style pizza once in a while and they do make pizza well, I just will be more careful about the way I order.  Avoiding meatballs and getting the plain wings next time.

One of my favorite pizza stops in LV. Be aware that their portions are huge! A great value. I believe I prefer the atmosphere of the Arville locatiob, but the staff on Paradise is super helpful and alert. I am salivating as I write this.

I rave to everyone about naked city ... closest thing I've found to real back home pizza spots ... but today was the worst pizza I've ever eaten ... 1/2 sheet meatball ,spinach if you wanna call it that and ricotta ... ZERO flavor don't think it was even cut we had to rip the pieces off and waaaaay over cooked .. not a win naked city

Guys trip to Vegas for March Madness. If staying at the Hard Rock it's a no brainer to go here. If on the strip, it's a strong consideration if you're a pizza fan or a DDD fan. Guy was here so check out the flavortownusa site as well. 

The pie here is money. Besides the crust being thick and cooked well, the toppings are Top Notch. 

We had 6 of us. We ordered 3 "wee" size pizzas and two orders of "wee" size fries. And almost finished everything. The pizza is very filling based on a thick doughy crust. 

One girl running all the tables was very good. If it was really busy, service could be really slow. However we did not have any issues. Good craft beer selections. No mainstream beer. 

I loved it, enjoyed the unique options and nothing disappointed. Hope I win some money at the Black Jack table tonight.

I've eaten here 4 times and the first 3 times the wait and the service was definitely needing improvement.... because they have one hostess doing the serving, seating, and taking phone orders BUT the pizza kept me coming back. THIS TIME! the pizza shrunk! WOW! And barely had any cheese and toppings on it. Consistency people! I took a pic of my small pizza next to a dollar bill and seriously?! I have a huge clientele and I'm always speaking highly of this place. I'm done! 4 chances was enough for me to het their game together. I came to this location because I live on the east side, maybe the original is better? But my naked city days are on hold for a while. Get it together people!

Absolutely loved Guinea's Pie...I just wish the crust was thinner. The service was fast & friendly. I will visit again for sure on my next visit to Vegas. The location was near where I was staying so it was easy to grab & go. Great quality & ingredients were fresh...yum!

My co-workers and I were in the mood for pizza and this place has been on our list of "places to try". It was sooooo worth buying a $40 pizza. It was HUGE! It was extremely cheesy, full of flavor and the toppings were great! My only negative comment would be that the pizza could've been more crispy. Kinda soggy in the center pieces. We ordered the Rebel pizza. We all agreed that we will order from here again!

Great tasting and visually appealing pizza. The service was slow since only one young lady was servicing the whole dining area. My wife and another lady with us ordered wine, but they were out. That was a bit of a bummer for them. Overall, 4+ stars on the food and service was about 2.5 stars. We'll be back next time in Vegas.

The pizza was sooo delicious!! $3 pepperoni pizza slices and two cannoli for $4. Looking for a good eat while in Vegas found this gem. Service was fast we ordered slices of pizza and were pleasantly surprised that they were about the size of a personal pizza. I would recommend anyone to stop by. I will definitely be back. Try this place you won't regret it.
The food was OK and the service was fine, I was expecting better seeing it on triple D. I likely wouldn't go again.
Excellant pizza and salad, fresh quality ingredients you can really taste. Friendly and helpful staff. Another great one featured on DDD.

If you love a good pizza joint as much as I do (and I love it a lot), you have to try Naked City Pizza! Miles above the other local pizza places I've been to in town, and the prices are more than reasonable. We tried the garlic buns, garlic fries, Guinea's Pie, and Naked City Pizza. My favorite out of the 2 pies was the Naked City - it's so yummy with an amazing crust. And the garlic buns?! Do yourself a favor - go ahead and order 2 plates so you don't have to share with whoever you go with. They're so good that they could be a meal by itself. The location is convenient to the Strip, the airport, and UNLV. The service? Quick and fantastic. Don't miss out - you haven't had great pizza into you've been to Naked City Pizza. I'll definitely be back!

This is my favorite pizza joint in Las Vegas  My fav pizza is their signature pizza called the Naked City.  It is really tasty even though I just eat the toppings off pizzas.  But, don't get me wrong the crust is delicious, I just don'teat a lot of bread/carbs. The chicken wings were big compare other places and not too bad.  I visit this restaurant again.

Had been looking forward to eating there. Was greeted by the woman at the counter, shown to a table, waited 15min then told the wait for pizza was 40. Server offered to call ahead to other location while we drove. There was no call. See other review for part 2. Poor planning on a busy evening.

Went to grab pizza and fries for dinner after work, and it's super convenient especially working in the industry and it's right off the strip.. It's always made fresh and the fries are fresh as well.. some of the best pizza you will get in vegas that is not a big chain!! Sharla is an amazing hostess/greeter/waitress and just good conversation.. she makes you feel like you guys have been friends for the longest time!! 
This place has an awesome ambiance and its laid back..

Hands down, my favorite is the Guinea Pie. And not just because Guy Fieri ate here hahah! My whole crew enjoyed this place. 

The Guinea Pie had a white sauce with ricotta and meatballs...heaven on a light buttery crust crisped to perfection...sigh, I'm sad they don't have a chain in Cali!! 

We also ordered the Back Home, though I enjoyed this one a little less than the Guinea. My comrades ravished it! 

They also ordered the bucket of (50) Buffalo chicken wings in which they were able to only kill about half of before our two pizzas came. 

You'd pass this place up if you weren't looking for it intentionally, it's quite small. 

Overall we had a really great dining experience. Our waitress was attentive, kind and put our experience over the top. 

If I knew how to give .5 stars, I'd have given this 4.5!
Great pizza. Crust is middle of the road, wide variety of toppings. Large beer menu. The dinning room was small. The staff was friendly.

Food is great! No complaints...... Meatball Skillet was delicious! I highly recommend this appetizer. So meaty, saucy, and cheesy... OMG..... heaven!
The Suicide Fries are a "try once" kind of thing. I LOVE hot and spicy food, I order 8 or higher at most Thai restaurants, but these things were so hot and spicy you couldn't taste anything beyond that, just hot!
You gotta get the Guinea!!!! It is a thick crust pie, "buffalo style",  a white pie with meatball and basil.... YES!!!! There is absolutely nothing wrong with this pizza!
The only reason I gave this location a four and not a five star is the service and experience. 
Maybe we caught them on a bad night.... but it took over an hour for food to get to the table. A couple of glasses of wine helped to pass the time, and the waiter kept apologizing telling us they had a big carry out order....anyway.... I will definitely be back for the food!

Honestly, one of the worst pizzas I've ever tasted (including store bought). I stopped by this location Thursday evening after class.  Tell me, why does the pepperoni curl up around the edges as if it's shrinking?!!?  Also, all the pepperoni fell right off the pizza when it was tilted or just turned upside down (really?).  Maybe it was a bad night, the pizza sure was (bad, that is).

My husband are big DDD followers and made it a point to come here while in Vegas. The paradise location was closest to us but our server told us the arville location is the one from the show and is more of a dive while the location we went to is more of a restaurant. Good prices. Our server was very friendly and told us that their most popular orders were the guinea pie and suicide fries. We had both and added the back home pie. The suicide fries were delicious but very very spicy! The guinea was great too (very "melt in your mouth" type.) Those pies are freaking filling! Very doughy. One is more than enough. They have a list of craft beers as well. I took stars off because the back home had a weird tomato sauce that I did not enjoy. What we got was good but not the most amazing pizza I've had.
i paid 17.50 for this and didnt even get what the menu says. It said 12 tenders I got 5. The fries were under cooked and cold. Plus it took the 45 minutes to make this order and it was still wrong.

OMG, if your a pizza lover or not Eat here. The Back Home pizza & garlic fries were absolutely delicious. Our server was great and the atmosphere was family friendly. Will definitely visit again during our Vegas trips.
Apparently taking an order is really hard waitress is an idiot I waited an hour for my food , I should of just went to metro pizza .
Stopped in for a slice on the way to airport. Absolutely amazing pizza! The girl with all the tattoos taking the order was absolutely miserable.

After hearing wonderful words about Naked Pizza, I finally had the opportunity to see why hours  before attending the Yelp 2018 Elite Badge Day at the Hofbrauhaus on January, 18. It was their Sicilian pizza that led me to write additional wonderful words about Naked Pizza.

   Born and raised in New York, I recognize exceptional pizza. In New York, Sicilian pizza is popular. However, in Las Vegas Sicilian pizza is limited to a few establishments. "What is Sicilian pizza?" You may be asking. According to Wikipedia:

     "Sicilian pizza is used to describe a typically square variety of cheese pizza with dough over an inch thick, a crunchy base, and an airy interior."

  According to this review, Naked City saved considerable money and time to savor two slices of Sicilian pizza. In lieu of an $800* round trip flight to New York City, it costed me $9.54 plus a $1 tip to savor the two slices of Sicilian pizza with mushrooms. It was $2.75 per slice plus 50 cents for the toppings. The glass of Coke was $2.50. And after chowing down the Sicilian pizza, I have something to shout out about. "This hole in the wall pizza restaurant at the resort/ UNLV dividing line practically across from the Hard Rock Hotel gives the typical New York pizzeria Sicilian pizza, a run for their money. The one difference was that this cheese overflowing from the thick square corner slices onto the square white plate was whiter than the Sicilian pizzas that I know of in New York."

  At the 3 o' clock hour on a Thursday afternoon, business was slow. Upon walking in from the one entrance that faces Paradise Road at the northeast corner with Naples Street**, the man at the counter greeted me. He told me to sit anywhere in the dining room. He brought me the one page menu (shown below). From reading this review, I assume that You would think that Sicilian pizza was my first choice. This isn't the case. If their sandwich menu included the eggplant parmesan sub (in New York called hero), I would have ordered it. After a few minutes, the man returned from the register to take my order. He would make a few additional trips from the register to my table to bring me my glass of Coke, my food, and my check. I rate the service as solid.

  The restaurant could be described as a hole in the wall. In my opinion it reminds me more of a College town restaurant at the periphery of a university. A couple of these College town restaurants that come to mind are the former Park Bench outside The State University of New York at Stony Brook and the Bally Hoo by Indiana State University. The reality is that Naked City Pizza is both a College and resort town restaurant. It sits off the Paradise Road corridor which separates the UNLV and Las Vegas Strip Resort District. At any rate, the gray walls are adorned with a flat screen TV, a Buffalo Bills pennant, interesting framed pictures that include family portraits, historic Las Vegas, football, and hockey. Hanging on the window facing Paradise Road is the 2017/18 Golden Knights schedule. Instead of sitting at a bar stool, I sat at one of the wooden tables overlooking the gray walls of pictures.

 It is encouraging to see that there are restaurants in Las Vegas that serve the same delectable New York foods that I grew up with. The two slices of Sicilian pizza that I savored in Naked City Pizza live up to those that the typical New York pizzeria had served me.

Great food but don't go when you are starving or in a hurry. Good food takes a bit to get to you.
The salad ingredients were very fresh, delicious, savory. 
The pizza crust is the bomb. Soft. The toppings were delicious; garlic fries - shut your mouth best ever and fresh sliced potatoes NO DOUBT about that.
We ordered the Margherita and Naked Pizzas and neither disappointed.
Love the over abundant use of green olives. And any beer you could imagine - draft bar is not operating so it's all bottles. 
Simply amazing.
This place was great! Service was great salad wings fries pizza were delicious. We will definitely come back here the next time we visit Vegas

This place is quite popular and has been on a few TV shows.  We decided to try it on a Saturday night and have it delivered to us.  We ordered a 1/4 sheet cheese pizza with no toppings.  When it arrived and we opened the box we noticed it was totally burnt and near inedible.  I'm afraid we won't be returning or recommending.
Service is a little slow! But worth the wait!! So delish!!!

I usually love this place, but I went and wanted one of two things. The steak and cheese pizza or the 51 and they have gotten rid of both! Guess I won't be going there for a while since the create your owns are too expensive and they got rid of the two pizzas I love. Too bad. Hope they come back around soon. The atmosphere was also very hurried and the cook staff was a little curt and rude to the wait staff.
Awesome place friendly lady at the reg at night with great info for first timers there great pizza its rectangular for cheap I'm definitely going back when I'm in the area again

It was ok, not as good as the original. The pizza seemed lacking of sauce & cheese. We asked for pizza fries & were told they don't do them & haven't for over a year & that we must be looking at a menu for a different location. I told the guy that I am looking on yelp at the menu for that location & he said they must have not changed it. First thought, you are a pizza place, how hard is it to make pizza fries. Anyway we had the garlic fries & they we pretty good. The people were nice but the product just not as good as the original. Had someone contact me about my review from the restaurant & said that pizza fries aren't on the menu, unless they have changed it, it was when I ordered a week & half ago.

My uncle is a local in town and recommend this place, and thank goodness he did. We had a great sandwich along with wings and a pizza (can you tell we were on vacation). If you like garlic get the steak in the grass, it was amazing and super juicy. The wings were also great and since they were cooked on the grill or smoker, they had a unique char taste that really set it apart. Can't wait to visit again!!!

Mediocre at best. The environment is nice with a New York vibe, pictures hanging on the wall. The staff was nice, greeted us and sat us down. Ah, the pizza though. Something was left to be desired. I hate to make the comparison but it tastes like Little Caesars. Very bready, no toppings and flavorless....I ate 2 slices and don't want a to go box for the rest. Wouldn't recommend
The Pizza was amazing! The hand made crust had the best flavor! We tried the one recommend by Diners Drive In and Dives and we were not disappointed!

So I was totally looking forward to eating here on our trip to Vegas especially because of all the Yelp reviews and being on DD&D...here's the point I will make right off. You can deliver solid food, but if you can't deliver on service consistently then the food will only carry you so far. 

We came in and where immediately greeted by a female employee obviously suffering from a bad day...but from what I could tell from the other patrons we were not the only ones suffering from from her bad mood. Either way we were committed and wants to try out these pies. First disappointment 2 beers on tap? 2nd the appetizer we ordered the Philly egg rolls...these were Meh at best. Very greasy and not much flavor. But we were not here for the appetizers and here for the pizza. So after not too long of a wait out came the pizza...we ordered Guninea  pizza and the Margherita 1/4 sheets both were very solid choices. This is what we came in for but isn't deserving of a 4 or a 5 star just because nothing else really delivered. I would be willing to give this place another try and hope that our service was a one time fluke.

Very tasty pizza, crust was on the thicker chewy side, which I don't mind. We had the Rebel  pizza,  a half sheet, that the two of us could not finish. 
Typical Triple D spot,  small facilities and BIG on the flavor. 
The Rebel:
PEPPERONI, IN-HOUSE ITALIAN SAUSAGE, HAM, SALAMI, MARINATED TOMATO, FRESH BASIL, RED SAUCE, MOZZARELLA

I come in here pretty frequently with my boyfriend and we always have a nice experience. But last week when we went in, around 2pm Wednesday, I've never seen employees act so unprofessional. My boyfriend had a complaint about his food and we asked for the manager, and when they asked for him we could hear him cursing in the back that he was needed up front and when he approached us he reeked of weed and could not have been any more unprofessional. We will definitely not be visiting this location again.

Went to this location for the first time(the other location I go to twice a month but this is closer to my mom's house)....a "treat" for my mom on mother's day. I bragged about how good their pizza was ( the location on Arville and D.I has NEVER let me down)..... the staff at the Paradise location were VERY nice..... VERY COOL ! but when we got to our destination and opened the boxes, the pizza lacked and the fries sucked (see pic)...... and my mom lives 6 miles down the road and they want me to turn around and bring back the food even though I told them I took pics? The wings were very good but the crust on the pizza really lacked.. So I call them up to see what can be done about my dissatisfaction: The staff on the phone explained their policy....."Ya gotta bring back the pizza and fries mostly uneaten with your receipt"... even though I took pics ?... all I asked for was a partial credit on the pizza and full refund on the fries. All together with sides I spent $62.00. I will not return to this location but I will go back to my rat hole on Arville and Desert inn.... Maybe bad day for cook and they make pie differently down there.... I will never again go to this location.

GOD BLESS BUFFALO, NEW YORK!! 

Ok, maybe I'm biased but I think my hometown has some of the best food in the nation. Having wandered west I have struggled through some pretty horrific culinary wastelands. Still trying to get over the horrible food in Colorado where people think Olive Garden is good Italian (insert hard eye roll here).

Vegas, no doubt, has great food but Naked City just became a weekly spot for me. 

I came in just off good reviews. Looked at the wall - Buffalo Sabres, Buffalo Bills pics...hmm interesting.

Looked at the counter - Weber's mustard...hmm.

Next to the mustard, Chiavetta's marinade...hmm.

Sahlen's hot dogs? Ok what's going on here? It was like a Buffalo parade of foodie happiness. I ordered the suicide fries (yes not for the faint of heart), 10 hot wings and a half sheet of Naked City pizza! I figured I wanted leftovers!

After eating, I demanded to see the owner. Yes, he was from Buffalo. I hugged him like he was a long lost brother. 

AMERICA, PLEASE, FOR THE LOVE OF GOD AND ALL THINGS HOLY - stop asking for ranch with your wings. It's blue cheese. It's always been blue cheese. You wouldn't have a peanut butter and mayonnaise sandwich would you? Don't ask for ranch - it's embarrassing - you should know better. It's wings with blue cheese just like it's peanut butter and jelly. Come correct and don't embarrass yourself. Thank you. That is all.

Quick, friendly, plenty of parking, no internet.

Dough was slightly chewy.

Soda was in cans so there were no free refills.

Pizza is ok, not Spectacular, but ok. Everyone claims to be Original New York Pizza. Being from New York, I tell u , it is not. But, if in area , is ok. Restaurant itself has no atmosphere, but waitress was super nice.
Had a tall blonde waitress tonight. Great service and she was working her ass off alone. They need more great staff like her. Pizza was great also. Top 3 in Vegas.

This place is incredible. I'm so lucky it's 5 min from my house. I got the guinea pizza and the poutine fries. Both were really good but a lot of the fries were burnt. Their pizza on the other hand though is phenomenal. I will start getting my pizza only from there. The restaurant is kind of confusing to get to but the interior is really cute. They also have a awesome hipster beer selection. The blonde lady with the tattoos was super helpful and friendly and was running around like a chicken with her head cut off cause there was only 2 servers (her and another girl) working. This establishment is super good, also their half slab of pizza is giangantic. Worth every penny

Great to find a pizza place that doesn't have the typical, bland, pizza flavor. We started with the house salad which amazingly had spinach. The dressing was ultimate. Never tasted a dressing like that before. Already looking forward to the next visit. The pizza had a unique flavor and the toppings were fresh and tasty. Beef and sweet peppers on a delicious crust. Service is fast and pleasurable. Definitely the best pizza in the area. Easy parking too.

my only complaint is customer service,
they were very slow to take the order, never checked on us to see how it was and I had to find an employee for the check.

keep in mind it was my boyfriend and I and only one other couple in the entire place. So there should not be any excuses there.

As for the food. BOMB. A+

I'm a fan for sure. Sisters brought me here for lunch after a long night and boy did this hit the spot. The place is reasonably priced with decent enough seating. Parking was probably the only major negative point as its small and annoying.

We ended up ordering their frickin' huge pepperoni pizza which, as the name suggests, was FRICKIN' HUGE! With the pizza we ordered a couple of fries where were basic but good to much on as the pizza came out. Garlic Fires came out on the cooler side which was disappointing but the regular ones were nice and hot. 

Service was also steady. Its a smaller place so they only had one server, which I could see becoming a problem if the place was packed but our experience was fine. 

Look forward to making another visit next time i'm in Vegas.

I want their pizza now!!! and the garlic knots. they have the BEST GARLIC KNOTS!!! their steak pizza is delicious. I say get a full sheet and split the two half to try different pies. (yes I like to try a lot of different things) . I just wish they had a delivery guy so my work would always order from them. 
they also carry a nice selection of draft beer. microbrews. 
PARKING LOT ISSUES - IT IS TINY. the place isn't really that big either but itd be nice to have more parking space.

Just had a white sauce pizza with ricotta and mozzarella OMG SOOOO GOOD! The saltiness of the mozzarella and sweetness of the ricotta was a nice balance.  I was going to take a picture of it but I was so excited to eat it I forgot lol. I'll take a picture behind the glass.
This place has the best pizza, sandwiches and Food in Las Vegas. I am a local and this is my go to place affordable and fresh!

Las Vegas has some of the best pizzas joints in town and I'm glad to add Naked City Pizza near the top of the list!! 

The Buffalo-style pizzas are made in a rectangular pan like Sicilian pizzas, but with a thinner crust. You can get them plain or loaded with a wide variety of toppings that includes everything from bar food like chicken fingers, sirloin steak and meatball. 

The pizzas are huge and I ordered a personal size, six huge pieces I was lucky to finish three.   
I ordered the popular GUINEA PIE - Meatballs, Spinach, Ricotta, Spinach, Ricotta, White Garlic Sauce and Mozzarella. The slices are gooey messy cheesy, fattening and delicious, easily one of the best I have had from a hole-in-wall pizza place.
