The other item I noticed on the appetizer menu is the MEATBALL SKILLET which is seriously out of this world good. The meatballs were nice and caramelized holding in all the flavors.   

The service was awesome, staff was very nice. I enjoyed Naked City Pizza and I can't wait till they open there third location near Henderson.

I have to say my experience here was great! Collen took good care of me ( shes super cute too) i rocked the Guinea Pie and it was outstanding , do the 1/4 sheet and get a box. Not traditional but still very flavorful and super chill atmosphere. Ill be back !

I can't say enough positive things about naked city pizza. Took my boys for dinner. I started my meal with a local craft beer. We ordered garlic fries and a guinea pie omg. So much food I think they had to wheel me to my truck. My picky sons even devoured their food. In a city full of amazing food naked city pizza is most certainly at the top of the list.

I'm a bit of a pizza snob, so I tend to order through places like Rosati's and the higher rated small stores. If I have to order from a franchise, I do Pizza Hut. I think the founder of Papa Johns is a d-bag, and Dominos is just flat out awful. That's my TMI on pizza preferences. 

I saw Naked City on Postmates, and thought I'd give it a try. I'm happy I did. Their pizza has an extra thick layer of cheese, which I liked, but the sauce was a bit sweeter than I think it needed to be. the sausage was quite good and didn't have that artificial level of spice that some add. 

We ordered the big pizza, which is huge. We also ordered a bad of zeppoles, which were pretty good too. They come with a small container of chocolate. (If you like chocolate, ask for and extra container, the one didn't do it for the who bag).

Overall it was a pretty good dinner, and we all agreed it was far above any of the big name pizza guys, but not quite Rosatis. But I should mention the price is pretty decent for the amount you get with the big pizza.

Wowza this was a great decision!

A friend brought a pie to work and it tasted great, so I had to try it again.
It was so delicious... I didn't care for the garlic rolls but the pizza was excellent.

I can't wait to try other items on the menu.
Had to try this place because of all the great reviews and it was on DDD. The suicide fries did not disappoint! Hotter than hell and the habanero sauce was great! The rebel pizza is awesome as well!

Visible from my hotel room, I decided to stop in. It was empty and I mean empty on an early evening, so I had my doubts.

Menu was compact and it turns out it was featured on TV (was not aware of this before stopping in). The waiter recommended the guinea pizza and I'm glad I took him up on it: fantastic pizza. Perfect meatballs, perfect crust, perfect cheese and garlic. Even the temperature was perfect. Leftovers tasted great cold the next day, too. This place definitely was punching above it's off-strip location, and I'd absolutely eat here again next time I'm in town.

My cohort descended on Naked City Pizza on Paradise for an end of the semester party. I had made reservations the week before and upon arrival, an employee began putting tables together for our large party. Service was spotty, but everyone was a fan of the specialty pizzas we ordered. A huge crowd pleaser was actually a beer that tasted like blueberries (#4 on the beer menu). 

MARGHERITA: Not a single slice was left! This was probably among the best margherita pies I've ever had. The pizza tasted incredibly fresh and the crust was perfect. Awesome for vegetarians or those who prefer non-meaty pizzas. 5/5

NAKED CITY: Looked colorful and toppings were spread with a heavy hand. My professor loved this pie. 

REBEL: I didn't get a chance to snap a pic but this was another popular pie.

VIBE: Oldie music played in the background. The inside of the restaurant is small and cozy. There's a pretty extensive beer menu on a large chalkboard near the entrance. Wine is available, but they only had 2 variations on hand.    

*Located across the street from the Double Down Saloon.   

Worth a Return Visit?
Naked City Pizza is worth a visit for any pizza lover.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2016: #11

When Chris Palmeri announced a whole new menu at Naked City Pizza on Paradise it was only a matter of time before a visit was planned, Saturday's pre-concert meal proving a perfect opportunity to gather seven adults plus three children and taste eleven new items including one still in progress plus a couple old favorites.

Still working hard across multiple venues, Christopher stopping by briefly during a typically busy day but otherwise leaving dinner in the capable hands of Robert Chaney, it was with several tables pushed together along the near wall that diners sat with Soft Drinks in hand, Sinatra crooning overhead as the "Happy Plate" arrived featuring housemade Pickles plus Olives and two styles of Cheese, all of it quite good but a "best bite" a Floret of Cauliflower on toasted Bread with a smear of Chevre tinged in Honey. 

Going for the gusto next with the aforementioned work-in-progress, an ever-creative Chef planning new catering options with "Pizza Doughnuts" featuring Cheese and Pepperoni at the center of a crispy Fritter, suffice it to say that the table's self-designated "picky kid" devoured two despite poo-pooing several other items without even a taste, the Pizza Sub that is essentially a toaster-style French Bread Pizza converted into a Sandwich also making a good impression. 

Enjoying a big bowl of Fries along with two additional sliced Sandwiches, the Matty P stacked thick with Cold Cuts plus Vegetables slicked in housemade Vinaigrette and Ham Slaw living up to its billing as "the best Ham Salad you ever tasted," it was next that four new Pastas would arrive, the Cappellini and Sunday Gravy both offering extra-thin Noodles topped in Sauce though only Vegetarians or those on a diet should select the former over that which is upgraded by slowly simmered Beef and Sausage. 

Hearing others state the Mushroom Alfredo was a bit "bland," a lack of overwhelming Salt in comparison to many not unwelcomed by those who appreciate the flavor of Mushrooms, it was nonetheless that all present felt Naked City's Penne a la Vodka was the best dish of the night with Pasta still featuring some tooth tossed in Sauce that balances Herbs, Meat and Tomatoes elegantly. 

Never one to exit any Naked City location without Pizza, a Midwestern childhood built on thicker Crusts making Palmeri's Pies as reminiscent as they are delicious, it was eschewing the Back Home or Guinea in favor of one dubbed "Buffalo 22" that the crew got their fix, some not loving the Hot Honey as much as others but those who did grabbing extra slices before polishing off a sizable portion of Chicken Parm for just $14 and wrapping things up with Sin City's best Cannolis.

FIVE STARS: Always taking chances and usually coming up a winner Naked City Pizza remains a quintessential part of Las Vegas' dining regardless of location, though the place on Paradise remains the most well appointed with the recent menu changes adding yet another reason to visit.

I'm a local I live a mile from this place , pass it all the time so I finally stopped. I love local neighborhood vibe they got going here, it feels really good walking in everyone's friendly and all know each other and just having fun enjoying there lunch, I've been following them on the socials and they are very active in the community and sports community as well it nice you can walk in and order a couple of slices for a quick lunch. I ordered the traditional cup and char pepperoni and it was delicious. Basically they had me at  crust!

I laying down the law.  NCP IS TOP 5 Pizza in Las Vegas, culinary capital of America.  
Two turntables and a Drop the microphone.  
Done.
You can keep it OG with Pepperoni or try their meatball riccota concoction.  
Square slices.  Crust is like a thin deep dish.
Ingredients on Fleek.
Run don't walk...

If you are craving Buffalo style pizza then this is the place. If you're from Buffalo then you know that yeasty flavor of the crust and the pepperoni needs to form into little cups. You get that here. If you want some great Poutine look no further.

So im on a mission to eat at as many triple D restaurants as possible. When I found myself in Vegas i thought I would try this out because hey who doesn't love pizza?! So I decided to go with the wee guinea pizza but swapped the meatballs for their house made Italian sausage and a glass of flavored iced tea. The tea was ok initially tasted weird as I was expecting pain tea but it grew on me. 
Now the pizza. Oh the pizza. I consider myself somewhat of a foodie. I love good food and I'm willing to pay to get it. Initially I want too impressed with the pizza and almost asked for some dipping sauce but decided against it. Best choice I ever made. I slid that streaming hot piece of pie into my plate and hesitantly took a small bite so as not to burn my mouth off. Oh man, let me tell you, this pizza is amazing! The crust is thick ava chewy and cooked just right n the toppings do something magical and definitely check you onto the train to flavor town, express route! The homemade sausage is to die for! Very spicy but oh so good! And they put several large pieces. I definitely think two could share the wee pizza. 
I will be back here next time I'm in Vegas and next time I'm bringing a friend so we can split and try more. The fries looked fresh cut and delicious but I salt didn't have any room left to try them. 
Service was impeccable. No issues there. 
Now stop reading this and come here now and eat this pizza.

Went here for dinner while in Vegas on vacation last Tuesday.  They were out of the pizza rolls so we ordered the Garlic Buns w/ red sauce. They were basic rolls w/ some garlic butter, not too bad but nothing to write home about.  For dinner we got the Guinea Pie.  This was very good!  Delicious meatballs and cheese, the crust was very good as well.  Our server was a young, hipster fella who was very nice and helpful.  Bonus points for having the Preds vs. Ducks game on!

First off. The tastiest food. The chicken wing dip is a must! And you can't go wrong with any pizza choice. Portions are huge and pizza is filling so keep that in mind. Also, from what I understand, the owner is very kind and generous. He does a lot for the Las Vegas community and is a proud Las Vegan. Love this place so much.

This is my FAVORITE pizza spot. So underrated. They have speciality day of pizzas, had one with arugula, egg, and white sauce and I think my tongue spontaneously combusted.

They have some seriously delicious loaded fries as well as a unique pizza menu. Just smothered in fatassery. Can't go wrong with that.

Delicious, authentic, easy to access by UNLV.
First time. Delicious pizzas and stuffed mushrooms. Don't leave without trying the Guinea pig pizza. Only downside the size of the place...small. Avoid lunch hour.

This is our second visit and it was as good as the first. It is great pizza ... period. Ingredients are fresh and have good flavor. You red sauce is not bland and you can really taste the tomatoes. The pizzas are huge! Salads are great and it is just a comfortable restaurant to hang out in. Had a great time and will continue to go back in the futirw
Fresh and fast!!! Delicious wings and awesome pizza. Great place to watch the game with dinner. Staff makes you feel like your family.

Guy Fieri sends us to another dive off the list of Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives! 

We recently watched Guy visit Naked City Pizza and found out they opened a second location much closer to our hotel and the Las Vegas strip, so we walked down a few blocks to grow our hunger for some pizza!

The place is definitely a dive! Very sports-bar esque theme, especially since the guys seem to be Buffalo Bills fans and have a few TVs in the restaurant. It also isn't very big at all, very close and quaint. 

We came by on Sunday around 1pm and there were only two other tables dining in and one worker the front of house running plates and cashier, etc. The worker was very nice and friendly and gave a great run down of the menu, including the sizing stating the small portions feed about 2-4 people and the 1/4 pizza sheets are about the size of the menus. We were also glad to see the menu had notations of which foods Guy Fieri ate so we remember what to order from the show! 

For the three of us, we ordered small suicide fries and a 1/4 sheet of the Guinea Pie. 
These "small" fries are definitely not "small"! 
Now, I get that these are called "suicide fries" and the menu clearly states how they are spiced with habanero and the likes. . . BUT I do wish the waiter had asked if we can handle spicy foods or if we would like ranch/blue cheese or something because these are damn spicy! We didn't even finish half of these but if there was some sort of dip or if the suicide sauce was put on the side, then sure. Overall though, the fries were very crispy and had great seasoning, and the habanero sauce was very flavorful! It had some true flavor other than just being suicidal in spice. 

Now for the pizza. This is some damn good pizza!! And the size was pretty big too, bigger than the menu for sure as he had mentioned before we ordered. The crust is thick like pan pizza or best comparison is to BJs restaurants, while also being buttery and crispy in a similar fashion! 
The Guinea is topped with house made "Grandma's" meatballs, mozzarella, ricotta, white garlic sauce, and spinach! These toppings combine to make such an amazing pizza! The meatballs are juicy and seared nicely, as you bite into them you can actually taste and feel the crust as they were just sautéed on a pan. The flavors are great and very well like grandma's meatballs! There is so.much.delicious.ooey.gooey.cheese. OHMYGOD. Every bite has my pulling the cheese from the crust i LOVE it! The garlic sauce is thick and creamy and has the perfect amount of garlic. The spinach brings it together for a fresh bite with the slight bitterness!

Overall, a fine establishment for food and alcohol pairings and to catch the game! I would love to come back for both the fries and pizza, but to be sure I get some ranch with those fries next time!

I was here yesterday with a group of about ten. The employees were great from start to finish! They even helped by pushing some tables together to accommodate our group. The restaurant offers a small selection of craft beers,  but you can also go to the bar next door (which is also super cool and has great specials).  

Our group got three 12 cuts and two appetizers. We tried two of the specialty pizzas (the names are escaping me but they were both delicious) and a pepperoni and mushroom. They came out piping hot and yummy! The dough and the toppings were all so good together. 

We also got the loaded potato fries and the stuffed mushrooms. While they were both delicious,  the mushrooms were my favorite! I would go back just for those! 

The whole group seemed to enjoy their dinner and I will definitely be back!

Without a doubt one of the best pizza places I've ever tried. And not just in Vegas, but overall. The Guinea Pie is a delicious must have, and the Steak In the Grass just as good. They've got a great selection of unique beers and the staff is so friendly and helpful. If you're lucky enough to find this off the Strip gem, please let's keep it to ourselves! :)
Very good food order a few items and share with a group. Very interesting atmoshere with family photos on the walls.

This was our first experience at this location.  We had been to other place and the pizza was amazing but service was beyond horrible.  Had some friends in town and good pizza seemed like the common thought, we came here to get a good pizza that wasn't a 'normal chain' type place.  We ordered two pizza's and they were both just ok, and the staff here was not as bad as the other location but it amazes me in such a small place such as this that your drinks being empty for extended periods of time as well as the one waitress not being seen in the dining room for extended periods of time.  I will order to go from the other location before I do this stop again.  I'm assuming the drinking and the proximity to UNLV is what keeps this location open.

Visited for the second time recently. It was early on a Friday evening. Party of 4. We had 2 meatball parm subs, a pizza, and something else. The food all came out cold. It was horrible. The sandwiches were cold, had very little sauce on them, a few pieces of meat. The food comes out sporadically. One sandwich came out, then the pizza and a little whle later the other sandwich. All food was cold and not good. Was really disappointed. It was not a busy time of night. It was before the rush and there were few other people in the place. It took forever and was bad food. Never again.

My sister raved about this place being so good and seeing it on triple D, but I beg to differ... we went here while my family and I took a little mini vacation to Vegas before the kids started school.  I didn't like anything we ordered,  the Sicilian wings were flavor less no hint of lemon what so ever. The white pizza we ordered was way too oily and seemed uncooked in the middle of the pizza. We also ordered garlic fries that could have been fired a little longer, I could keep going but I won't... I will not be ever returning to this established ever. The waitress was nice and helpful,  the sun was hitting us straight in the face and she did everything possible to shade us by putting pizza boxes up on the windows.

Located down the road from the Hard Rock, this is a LV must. First the prices will make you smile if you have been eating on the strip of a casino. Now its not papa john prices, but once you have a taste you know why.
We started with Garlic Roles and they are great. soft stringy cheese warm cheese inside and dip in sauce. 
We had the naked city a and Margarita Pizza 1/4 tray on each was more then enough for the four of us.You know a good  mozzarella  when it stretches more then a foot. All the topping are fresh tasting and full of flavor. Some might say there are not enough toppings, but their topping have a great full flavor you don't need it loaded. The crust was good and a perfect fit for the pizza, no issues here. 
Now it is a bit slow, but you are getting a true hand crafted Pizza, not a mega chain assembly line that is made for a 12 year soccer team party.

We were staying at Hard Rock Hotel and wanted to find somewhere to eat that had supported the first responders and victims of the Las Vegas shooting. There is a long list of restaurants that have done this, but we chose Naked City Pizza because it was close to our hotel. We are glad we got to stop in here, after we found it of course. So there is a sign on the corner of Paradise and Naples that would lead you to believe the pizza place is in this tiny shopping center on the right side of the road, but all we saw was a cannabis store and a different pizza place. We looked across the street in the other parking lot which was dark, and it appeared to be the back of a cheap motel and then a small building that said Office Bar. We flipped a U turn and tried again. Frustration set in as we really couldn't find it. We turned back onto Paradise and I called them. This is when their customer service started to shine. The young man who answered, I wish I had his name, he walked me through the steps to get back to the location. Well, Naked City Pizza storefront actually faces Paradise instead of Naples, and my only complaint is their sign is pitch black in the evening! As we were walking up there was a guy outside that said this is the best pizza in Vegas, so I had high expectations. We walked in to a fairly small establishment and the guy at the counter I assumed was who I spoke to on the phone, he was wearing a USA hat. He greeted us and seated us. He got our drinks, took our order, and all with a pleasant demeanor. I would say there's less than 12 tables inside with an additional several seats counter height looking out the window. A couple TVs that were playing Thursday Night Football. Mellow crowd. 

Our pizza came out about 25 minutes later, I just had a slice of salami and mushrooms, the salami was in little squares, I liked it. I'm a round table pizza kind of girl but this pizza was good. Fiancé got 1/4 pan of the "Rebel" which was 6 giant squares almost too much for his 6'3" 240 pound frame. His review: he's coming back. The crust and ingredients all standouts. 

Same guy that originally helped us was on top of refilling our drinks and answering our questions. when we were leaving we spoke to him and another guy about the reason we came to eat here. He told us more about what the company had done for the victims including other locations and fundraising. 

We visit Vegas often from Reno and this is now on our list of food stops.

Came here for the pizza. Crust is mediocre with chewy slightly undercooked taste in the middle.  Toppings are so so.  Sauce is very bland. The ambience is laid back with 3 TVs and music over speakers which are a good volume.  The waiter who wore a baseball cap was attentive and seemed to be working the room alone very well however I was looking at a long table of dirty dishes for 15 minutes prior to the table being bussed.   I probably will not come back for the pizza but may return to try their habanero garlic fries.

Naked City Pizza is a MUST anytime we are in Vegas. 

However you MUST bring back the Philly cheesesteak rolls.. why oh why did you ever take them off the menu..
Please bring them back ..

This more than just a pizza joint is still terrific.  Sad note though, they no longer have Genesee Cream Ale.  One of these days I'll have to try the suicide fries but I just can't get away from the amazing pizza.  I swear I'll try them next year when I return.

The wings are awesome the garlic rolls are stupendous.  The portions are ginormous. Our server was awesome.  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because they charged me for a refill on my soda.

Good poutine, good service, cheap greasy doughy pizza, really skimpy with toppings - that about sums it up, but keep reading if you feel like it. 

The poutine was pretty great and a steal for only $4 - fresh cut crispy fries with salty but good peppery gravy and generous amount of cheese. I could be wrong, but they seem to use mozzarella chunks, not cheese curds, which were also cold. The meal started out really well. Then came the pizzas...

We got small Guinea and Back Home Pies. Online pricing is wrong btw they were $13 each not $12, but even the wee size was pretty big. You can easily feed 2 with the wee because of how filling the super thick crust is. It was like an equally greasy, but not as crispy version of Pizza Hut pan pizza. 

They're really generous with the cheese, but stingy as hell with the toppings. This 2nd location recently opened, but don't believe the older pics from the Arville location or their online menu pics, it's super misleading. What they show on one slice is about what you get on half the pizza. The Guinea pie had MAYBE half a meatball on the entire thing, but was loaded with ricotta, mozzarella and spinach. Really dumb because the meatball is cheaper than the cheeses. The moisture from all that spinach also made the crust really soggy. The Guinea sounded awesome, but wasn't. The garlic white sauce also was extremely bland. 

Back Home was a little better - crust was super crispy in the beginning, but soggy after the first piece. Again, really generous with cheese, and short on sausage and pepperoni. It was better than the Guinea, but still not very good - soggy pretty quickly and literally dripping with grease. 

Service was great even though there was only 1 person doing the counter, phone orders and playing waitress. She was sweet and attentive. 

Also their tables are ridiculously small. Do not sit at a 2 top because the pizza pan takes up basically the entire table. They need to invest in the stands that most other pizza places have. 

I would return for take out on poutine and to try their loaded fries, and maybe the sandwiches. But I am not at all a fan of their pizza. I'd recommend this place if you're with a group and looking for value, but keep in mind that you're only filling up on bread and grease. I'd rather pay more for a smaller, better quality pizza.

The food was delicious the server was pleasant and efficient. I was impressed by the staff.

That said it took about an hour to get our food and they ran out of iced tea and fries during our dinner. 

Management congrats on your new location blow get it together and hire more staff. I love the crew and they are working themselves to death. Hire more crew. This wait is unacceptable.

This pizza is out of this world! I swear I have done nothing but crave it ever since I had it for the first time. So much flavor, super fresh ingredients, and amazing crust. Anyone and everyone should try this place, I promise it will be the best pizza experience you'll have.

This review is only for the one catering experience I recently had. I absolutely LOVE this Pizza. I've gone to this restaurant a few times and always love dining in. So naturally when I planned to host 40 of my closest clients, I chose Naked City.

I called in at least 3 weeks in advance for my order. Of course I had to call back as they do not return calls when they tell you they will.  They're busy.. fine I'll let that slide.

2 weeks before I place my order for 3 full tray pizzas and a large salad, they said it's a large order they had no problem delivering it to my venue. Perfect.

Days before my event, I called to change one pizza from pepperoni to a more veggie white pizza instead.

I've probably talked to the same catering contact 4 times by now!

Day of my event, 7pm start time, requested delivery was set for 7pm.  I get a call from a CA number at 6:30 which I happen to miss because I of course  am too busy setting up for my party.  Another missed call at 6:45, same number. Finally i check my messages to find out it's the catering man. He wants my credit card to charge BEFORE he can come deliver. By this time it's 7pm.   I call back and pay so he can bring my food while my friends are starving. He arrives 20 min late and all my Pizza is cold. The Guinea (my fav) is also burnt looking and most people didn't even touch it. The salad I asked them not to toss dressing on was tossed anyways and inedible so that went straight to the trash. Of course I had a party to entertain so I called back to let them know how upset I was and hoping they would offer a credit or something, but nothing. He was busy also And asked me to call back... great chasing him down again, no thanks.

Lesson learned - dine in only

The "ovens were cold" when we got there so it was going to be 30 minutes for a pizza. Most appetizers are also cooked in the oven, so they gave us some loaded baked potato fries on the house. These were amazing!  We ordered a margherita pizza which was NOT amazing.  The crust is pretty thick (so if you like that you'll be happy), but the sauce was really thick and strong in flavor.....and in my opinion a margherita pizza shouldn't be offered with this type of crust.

My first time here was yesterday and it was really good! Got there maybe around 2:30 ish. I loved how it was empty when we got there. We looked at the menu and we deceived to go with Naked City Pizza special... kind of like a supreme. Also, we ordered a ceaser salad. I really like how they make their own dressing and croutons. The pizza came and it was better than I expected! Didn't have room for dessert but I'll be back for it!

The crust is kind of thick but very flavorful, especially the garlic crust, on a white artichoke and pepper pizza that we shared.  I convinced my traveling companion to go back the next day and we got the Bianco pizza (has ricotta).  Delicious too.  The poutine was really good, the fries crispy, lightly herbed and the cheese fresh.  This location is about as close as you can get to the airport without being in the airport, so I brought leftovers with me.  (Leftovers for the plane is definitely in my plan next time).  You are greeted with bottles of cold water when you sit down, which I thought was a very nice touch.

Chris and Casey make the best pizza in town ,hands down. Having the Naked City Pizza tonight. All of the food here is amazing and lives up to its reputation.  Assorted Beers in bottle and on tap. The staff on nights is great. Come early and come hungry.

As a "professional" pizza connoisseur, I was had my doubts when a friend had claimed that Naked City had the best pizza in town. But, I am a lover of all pizza, so I went ahead and gave it a shot with an open mind.

It was about 8pm on a Saturday night, and the place was pretty full, minus a few spots on the counter which was where we were sat. We were given menus and asked what we want to drink and all that jazz. The server was hustling solo and she made sure to check on us as we took our time ordering beer and selecting a pizza. 

I opted for a Joseph James IPA that went perfectly with the sausage and pepperoni pizza with a garlic crust. Did you hear me?! Garlic crust. Buttery, parmesany, crunchy, yes soft inside, (did I mention buttery?) garlic crust. I was in love. 

This isn't the best pizza I have had in Vegas, or in my life, but it's a perfect spot for a slice, or a whole pie before, during, or after drinks. So for that, I thank you Naked City.

We stayee near here at an AirBnB and decided to give it a shot. Not dissatisfied in the least. We had read reviews that the service could be iffy but that wasn't the case for us. Quick.and friendly, our waitress was on top of it. Small dinning area with two giant TVs and a chalk board beer list (which was pretty impressive). The pizza was great! A 1/4 sheet was plenty for the two of us and we spent less then $20. Will certainly visit again next time we are in Vegas!

We visited the original Naked City pizza a couple of years ago and loved the food and service, since then they opened another location on Paradise and man did the service SUCK! 
They serve sodas by the can and they were out of several popular ones. The place wasn't even busy and our waitress was so slow..... We even called our order in 20 min before we arrived. We will not be returning to this location.

Pizza crust was a little too thick for me, but there poutine and suicide fries are killer and garlic knots are to die for. FYI they don't have booster or high chairs for kids so come prepared for that. Overall it was good good and nice atmosphere.
Wow, best pizza in Vegas, Colleen was an amazing server and enjoyed my experience.. I highly recommend Naked city on paradise..

This was my first time visiting this location as I am a huge fan of the location on Arville. Now while there was absolutely no drop off of service or overall expectation of the Arville location I have to say parking is a serious problem. If you come in off the main street you will drive in against parking indicators and then turn around in the tiny lot and park. Of course turning the corner and entering from the side makes sense, but good luck driving anything bigger than a Volkswagen through the lot. The Pizza was everything you would want, and I still say it's still the best Pizza in Vegas. It's just a lot harder to get to. One less Star for parking aggravation.

Great Sicilian style square pies & they're huge. We went with a HS basketball team, about 18 in our party. It is a small place, but we were there around 9pm so it wasn't crowded & we were able to take over the back tables. We ordered 2.5 sheets & it was the perfect amount. The teenagers got their fill & the bill came out to about $6 per person including drinks. What a great deal on some gourmet pie!

Simply amazing food! Pretty sure have had their pizza before but don't remember coming to this spot exactly.

This pizza was the Guinea pie, instead of spinach had them add pepperoni and it blew my socks off. Everything about the pizza was delicious.  Originally wanted my normal of pepperoni and sausage, but Alas, all out of sausage. The alternative was probably more delicious!

Today they had computer issues and everything was a little wonky, but the food more than made up for it.

Will be returning!

Wow. Wow. Wow! This place is really good. I'm somewhat of a white pizza "snob" and the Guinea Pie here is probably the best I've ever had. The meatballs and garlic white sauce really make it stand out. We also tried the garlic buns (really good, only $5!) and the meatball skillet. All very good. I know this place was featured on DD&D but aside from that it's pretty good pizza. TONS of beer choices also. What more could you ask for in a pizza joint? :)
